Review.Titre: STAY AWAY ! ZERO EFFORT OR CARE !
Review.Contenu: Bought and built there high end gaming pc , 4090 , z790-e wifi II , 7200mhz Corsair rgb ram , 360mm Corsair liquid cooler , etc etc , build came to almost 7000$ Canadian after tax . -issues memory wasn’t switched out , 4090 was delivery wedged and completely unseated , lian li cables were just connected and thrown into case up against 2 bottom fans . And the lian li cables weren’t even installed correctly . Paid for “professional wiring “ , paid for the memory , and they are completely unwilling to send the memory stick , and completely unwilling to do even a partial refund for the wiring , Will never buy or recommended . Terrible terrible terrible .

Review.Titre: I received a PC that did not work
Review.Contenu: I received a PC that did not work. I thought the premium I paid for a pre-built would be that I would get a PC that was already built and working? In any case, repairs take 1-2 weeks with absolutely no discount. The customer is completely ancillary to this experience, despite the very high premium being paid for a PC. Customer services is almost non-existent. I could not recommend this website less and I would caution anyone from buying from them.

Review.Titre: Received DOA pc,had to send it back and…
Review.Contenu: Received DOA pc,had to send it back and the agent made it seem like he was doing me a favor by not charging shipping and by "rushing" my repair to 7-14 days. I you'd for express service to ensure by Christmas, but I won't have it. Horrible experience... And still out that express money.

Review.Titre: Computer has frozen 4 times in 3 days
Review.Contenu: Computer has frozen 4 times in 3 days.  2 times while starting up, 3rd time while rebooting, 4th time while updating 2 days later overnight.

This being the second computer I bought through them and the first one has been working fine with no issues for about a year. That said, the second, more expensive PC shipped quickly and was basically dead on arrival. (Didn't seem to power on at all) It is currently back at CyberPowerPC to be "serviced through warranty" which I find funny but whatever we'll see what happens once it's sent back.

Horrible experience so far. I have received a computer that does not work. Now i am trying to fix it 1 step/day at a time myself via your instructions. I shouldnt have to fix a computer i spent this much money on.

Review.Titre: As a canadian this site makes things complicated.
Review.Contenu: As a canadian this site does not make it easy for you to get your package, on top of that they tell you, you need to cover custom charges, which are 550$ which is insane after spending 2800$ and they expect u to pay for it before u even get ur package. Not to mention my package has been stoped for 7 days without an update and still havnt gotten it on the expected arival date. Overall having a crappy experience so far, just want my computer.

Their customer service is okay when you're in the process of buying something. However, once you've bought a PC and encounter a problem, expect to be kept on hold for 30 minutes, receive no responses to your emails, and generally find that they avoid addressing your concerns, all while retaining your payment.

Review.Titre: My PC did not get delivered
Review.Contenu: My PC did not get delivered and it got sent back. No one is contacting me about my PC I have to reach out instead. Terrible customer experience. Now I have to wait another 2 weeks for my PC which I needed ASAP or get a refund. Also, a worker called Carlo C. doesn't respond to emails by the way.

Review.Titre: Removed factory case fans from the case…
Review.Contenu: Removed factory case fans from the case and did not include. Did not install the fans I ordered. Just installed some of them then put remainder in the box when there was PLENTY of room for them in the case.  Left out the accessories that come with components.  Liquid cooling system leaked all over unit and packaging because it was not tightened ANYWHERE.  Paid for "Professional wiring" and it looked like a birds nest in there. Ordered 2 pc's for $7500.00 and recieved ultra spotty craftsmenship.  This is my third time ordering pc's from cyberpower and each time it has gotten worse. There WILL NOT be a fourth.

I have had the computer for two weeks and have yet to use it, because of what appears to be a bad memory stick. I have sent the memory back and it has been received by CyberPower. But no word yet as of when I will receive the replacements. Meanwhile my 30 day guarantee is getting smaller by the day, for a pc that I  may have to return.
My new PC was great for four days and then it died.   I get a refund but have to pay the return shipping cost.  Hardly seems fair since their product failed!!

I’ve waited a few months to provide a review for my computer. Customer experience was limited but no issues when in contact from a support rep. Around 2 months after purchasing my custom rig, my computer began blue screening. This started happening around September. After the first blue screen, it began to slowly increase in frequency, up to a few times a day. Going over the dump files and talking to some outside sources of what a potential issue may be, came to a trial and error period. Began pushing and reseating connectors in the computer, which did not work. Eventually made my way to reseating my ram. This fixed the crashing for a few weeks, then began again. The crashing has continued till this day, months after the purchase. I have reseated my ram around 5 times, which allows it to run without issues for a couple weeks until it crashes again. Streaming my screen via discord has become choppy and I feel the computer is struggling. With the components I choose and the price I paid, this is unacceptable. Funny enough, I had two other friends who purchased custom rigs from CyberpowerPC, which one of them began having booting issues within the first 2 weeks, another where all games would crash and some blue screens. The two individuals purchased their computers roughly a few months from each other and have since sent them back, one is more recent but the other one two almost 2 months to get back, with no help from the CyberpowerPC support team. This will be the last computer is purchase from this company, I have since my early purchase of 2013, recommended this company to many others. Never again. I’m not sending my computer in to be left with nothing for months, horrible response time and with terrible quality control. Either the parts are defective and or refurbished but with a premium price tag. I’ll be replacing parts with my own money even after spending over $4,400.

Review.Titre: Got my PC and it doesnt even work...
Review.Contenu: Got my PC and it doesnt even work.... Still waiting on an email for a UPS Label so that I can send it back and hopefully the team can help me out with my problems for the PC.

Review.Titre: Since purchasing this laptop the screen…
Review.Contenu: Since purchasing this laptop the screen has gone out 2 times. The first time I had to send the laptop back to cyberpowerpc to be repaired after just using it for about 30days. Now about a year later the screen will not display anything again. When we reached out to support all they advised was to take it to a local computer fix it shop to get it looked at. This wasn't a cheap laptop to purchase and it hasn't even been 3 years since purchasing it and now it looks like I have to find a replacement.

Wiring is a rats nest. Tech help was less than acceptable. Basically I was told to find bad connections and reinstall both mem and gpu. I found connections hanging loose unconnected. Fixed it myself. Quality of connectors very low. I had to repair one. The average computer buyer would have returned it for a refund.

Review.Titre: Do not get your computers from CyberPowerPC
Review.Contenu: I obtained a desktop pc from them before this current laptop that I have. The desktop pc had been a gift to me, so I had not needed to deal with purchasing it. Upon the time now where I was getting a laptop from them, they sent me through so many loops just to show me there was no actual way for me to purchase the laptop from them. Countless calls to support to try and help with this. I was denied and flagged for fraud after using a credit card. Fine, that makes sense, I did not mind. I then have to wait quite some time due to personal reasons before I tried using my debit card, which was then still flagged for fraud and the order was denied. I then had to wait longer to transfer money to PayPal only for the website to tell me that I was not able to purchase this configuration through PayPal despite being told that my only options are to not use a credit card or use PayPal. They had so many sale advertizements, but they will gatekeep new people from purchasing their wares due to a lack of trust and flexibility. I will never get a computer from them again. I had to resort to having the people that helped with my first computer, buy it for me. Then I sent them the money through PayPal as repayment. Horrible experience, get your wares from some place else.

Review.Titre: I am out $6000 for a computer not used once
Review.Contenu: I am out $6000 for a computer that I never even got to turn on once.  It arrived with the coolant leaked completely out all over the computer, with no visible damage to inside or outside of the computer.  This leads me to believe it was not installed properly.

Review.Titre: I was sent faulty equipment for a time…
Review.Contenu: I was sent faulty equipment for a time sensitive need and then the replacement part cost me more money to send to me though not fault to my own. On top of this the replacement part was not overnighted and was sent through standard mail. I demand management call me and rectify this

I bought 2 PC's in a row that just stopped turning on.  Trouble shooted for days and seemed to us that it was faulty wiring between the power supply and the GPU.  Customer service blamed me for it I guess so they don't have to pony up and spend the money they scammed us out of.

At first everything went great my pc was built and shipped within the estimated time. However, UPS lost my order and since no one has contacted me first about what is going on, no emails about a replacement being sent or anything. It has been 3weeks since it was supposed to have been delivered and I’m still waiting. When I call the person I’m have to talk to is not in yet or the have already left for the day. No one can do anything for me, can’t even give me any information about what is going on.

Review.Titre: Computer dead out of box now gonna have…
Review.Contenu: Computer dead out of box now gonna have to go through a whole mess of troubleshooting.

I've had my CyberPowerPC computer for 2.5 years now. Throughout that time, it's given me issues but I've pushed through because I paid a lot of money for it. All the issues have been video issues. This always led me to believe that it was my GPU. Instead of doing any repairs or replacements, CyberPowerPC rep, Victor, continued to have me take my PC apart and perform workarounds to extend the life of my GPU. Never once was "replacement" ever mentioned. Now that we're past the one year parts warranty, here is the response I get when I insist on repair:Victor (CyberPowerPC)Nov 29,2023, 3:09 PM PSTYou are within the labor warranty, however, you would be responsible for shipping the PC to us, as well as the cost of any parts we would replace and the cost of return shipping the PC back to you.Any parts we would replace would only have a 30 day warranty, so if there is an issue with the PC or GPU after that and they need to be replaced, it would be the same process.A pleasure to be of service,--Victor - Tech SupportCyberPowerPC730 Baldwin Park BlvdCity of Industry, CA *******Tel: *******180-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------What sort of "customer service" is this? Making the customer pay for shipping, repairs, parts, and return shipping? And wrapping it all up with a nice condescending "A pleasure to be of service." My oldest wants a gaming computer and I should've been a returning customer. Many of the college grads we hire, their first purchase is a gaming computer and they ask me where they should buy. Suffice it to say, CyberPowerPC will never have my business again nor will they receive my recommendation

Review.Titre: First and last time buying a prebuilt PC
Review.Contenu: The CPU cooler supplied doesn't keep the CPU cool enough to prevent crashing. I told the warrantee team, who then refused to refund me as I had the unit longer than 30 days. I since replaced the cooler with a brand of my choosing and it helped it run cooler, but still hot enough to warp the motherboard because of the overclocking and power draw allowed by cyberpower's technicians. All in all, I'm never buying prebuilt again and am specifically avoiding all cyberpower branded products.

Review.Titre: New computer which is not working
Review.Contenu: Once I ran the new desktop, it gave me an error. Per Google research, it is either motherboard fault or usb ports fault. I called the cyberpower pc help desk and they requested me to reseat the CMOS battery, which makes no sense. In addtion, they requested to reseat RAM, but no changes. Currently, it is under RMA process. I hope I can have the computer that is working.

Review.Titre: My pc was not plug and play I had to…
Review.Contenu: My pc was not plug and play I had to troubleshoot and send back parts at extra cost. Geforce 4070 had known issues when i researched it but how would a common user know? They should not sell them if they don’t work. My old cyberpower pc was plug n play and the only reason i need a new pc is bec it’s so old it cant support the newer graphics cards.

Review.Titre: PLEASE READ THIS CYBERPOWER AND MAKE THINGS RIGHT
Review.Contenu: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANYOne month after ordering my computer I have received my computer 2 times both broken! Claimed to have had repairs and stress tests done and have had constant crashing after 20 minutes of downloading updates. Now I’m out 100 dollars for fast shipping that was never refunded as well as 69 dollars for my return label for my money back. Yes I have to pay to return my broken computer. AGAIN DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! TERRIBLE PC BUILDERS! TERRIBLE TERRIBLE! If I could leave a zero star I would. Oh and don’t believe because of they comment on other reviews saying to contact them to make things right they will because they won’t. CYBERPOWER BLOWS!

When i received my custom pc the cables were not all correctly attached even though i had spent extra for cable management. I had to waste time figuring out how to fix this issue.Also after getting my monitor weeks later it had a factory defect on the screen. The return process was long and i was given an incorrect return label and had to pay shipping myself.  Upon receiving replacement monitor i did not receive a mew monitor I received a refurbished one which has display issues and was missing a cable.

Review.Titre: Mailed me a 4000 dollar pc and it…
Review.Contenu: Mailed me a 4000 dollar pc and it wasn't built correctly. Computer had to be sent back and refunded. Numerous dead parts inside. Terrible builders. Dont believe for a second the computer was stress tested because the gpu didnt even have proper power cords plugged into it

Sent a lemon PC.  Did troubleshooting via their support.  Did both software and hardware tests.  No issue in the software but ended up having a hardware issue.  Bought the PC for my wife and was only able to use it for 2 days before acting up.  Had to ship PC out and pay $100 shipping on my end for a PC that was sent not working.  I had previously purchased a higher end PC for myself years ago with no issues but after this debacle I will not be back.

$2000 PC arrives with thermal issues! I guess no one tests the PC after build. The incompetent technician, did not remove the plastic protective film from the AIO cold plate. I had to take it apart and remove the film and reapply thermal paste. The also overtightened the cold plate to the CPU and indented the cold plate itself. It now works well but I did send pictures and a complaint to "Customer" service at CyperPowerPC and they "started a file." What does that do? How about you monitor your technicians better and put testing processes in place. Horrible!

Review.Titre: Assembly on my computer could have been…
Review.Contenu: Assembly on my computer could have been MUCH better. The hard lines for the water cooling system have terrible bends and some are too long/not square to the fittings. You really should test things like rgb lighting systems to make sure they work as they should. One of the memory sticks does light up, but is not seen by the rgb controller software, so you can't change the colors on that on thing to match the rest of the lights in the system. The rgb on the gpu water block never worked. The 'professional' wiring is a joke; routing wires where they are in plain sight and blocking the view of the system is just bad planning/untrained assembler.All this after buying the pc and on the day it was scheduled to ship I got notification that some parts were out of stock and I had to wait 3 weeks longer than I was told when I put in the order. Not at all pleased with the product I got or the service from CyberPowerPC.

Had issues with components not working on initial startup. Their support does not respond to support requests. It’s irritating when you spend thousands of dollars to have a paperweight on your desk. Then have to spend hundreds more for repair shops and replacement parts of a brand new system.

$4k system went through 2 QA checks (across 2 days), but still arrived DOA. Got quick response for RMA, but after week delay for initial ship and now delay for RMA, will be at least an extra month between initial “expected ship date” before I might be able to use what I paid for (that is if the replacement PC works properly out of the box). CyberPowerPC’s QA is seriously disappointing.

I placed my order on 07/05/23. Today is 07/24/23 and my new pc build still has not updated for anything. No assembly date, no warehouse date, not ship date, nothing. I am running thin on patience. I chose your company because of the reputable reviews i have heard but, this is just awful customer experience. I will be contacting the company soon if nothing is updated.

The order never went to plan from the start. Components not in stock, motherboard failure during testing. When the PC arrived, one of the plastic feet on the case was broken and many wires loose or not fully seated. Ultimately the PC needed to be returned, I could not get a signal from the onboard graphics or the main graphics card to the monitor using multiple cables.

Review.Titre: Put an absolutely garbage PSU in my…
Review.Contenu: Put an absolutely garbage PSU in my system. I didn't expect a Corsair for free, but god damn, Apevia is a borderline safety liability. No excuse for that kind of corner cutting.

Purchased a PC with a specific case before confirmation of the order. They spent two weeks building my order after confirmation, it still came with wrong case. They offered to give me "$20 to card account" as compensation, then stopped responding to the emails regarding it. lmfao.

During the build process it claims to go through multiple quality checks, but my pc had problems day one. talked to support through emails and they suggested to install new drivers and reseat gpu and ram. both were done and problem seemed to be fixed. tried to turn it on a few days later and power button just blinks nothing else turns on. tech support so far has been vague and unhelpful.

I ordered a custom gaming computer that was damaged in transit.  When I contacted Cyberpower, their representative was completely dismissive of my concern.  I tried multiple times to get updates.  I never received any from Cyberpower.  I was hung up on twice and treated as if I had caused the problem.   The only information I was provided came from UPS.  Even the sales manager was rude and condescending.  He refused to return calls and insisted on sending emails.  He even lied in his email about not knowing about the status when it was easy to see with the UPS tracking number.   I've never experienced hostility like this when trying to purchase something.

The PC only lasted for about 20mins and went dead. Then spent the next 3 hours bouncing between your support to asus support. And find out in testing the cpu 0 and ram was giving errors. On top of that if I would have bought it from any store my 3 hours of BS should never happen. I would have gotten a replacement pc and they would taken that pc and did what ever with it but no you only give a repair only with any purchase which is a &$&$&"&"^$&"&$&×$*^:&$+@*[(%_# BS.

The PC showed up late and when I called to inquire where it was the shipping company told me to call Cyberpower and Cyberpower told me they could not help me and that I should cancel the order and get my money back when/if they found the PC. When it finally showed up it was in a Blue screen loop.

This computer cost a lot of money and not only was it sent to me completely pre-build because I know very little about building a computer they put every single fan in backwards, so I had to take it to a shop to get it fixed and now there’s another issue I can’t identify where everything disconnects and the pc has to be hard reset and I can’t find a fix for this. I can’t believe they would charge that much and they can’t even put a computer together correctly.

Review.Titre: Dead GPU on Arrival, Big Disappointment
Review.Contenu: Paid $3100 for a new computer. GPU was dead on arrival even though it “passed” 2 quality controls. Reach out and got an RMA initiated. Sent a regular shipping label (3-5 days), it arrived and was told it’d be 7-10 days before a new part is sent out, then presumably another 3-5 days to get the part back. So somewhere from 2-3 weeks to replace a faulty part outta the box, thank goodness the onboard graphics worked so it wasn’t a total potato. Just an all-around disappointing and frustrating experience for something I spent 3 grand on. On another note, customer support was helpful and polite when trying to walk through troubleshooting and finally getting the RMA setup. As of now, would not recommend.

Paid extra for specific GPU selection, MSI Gaming X Trio and was sent the Gaming X Trio CLASSIC .. Not what I paid for, you downgraded me instead, complete false advertising. Probably seek legal intervention since I reached out to you and you refused to exchange to the exact model I ordered and that was printed on my invoice. Good luck.

I order a whole pc for almost 4k. It came with issues on the GPU, so I had to return the video card. I also had to put 1600$ holding on my credit card until I receive the new video card. It was supposed to be here by 7 business  days but every time i call no one really knows how long it will take. All I wanted is the new card to be here ….
My pc arrived non operational. I tried trouble shooting and then requested warranty service. I have still yet to receive a shipping label to return the pc to cyberpowerpcs location

Review.Titre: Multiple BSOD after receiving the PC
Review.Contenu: Multiple BSOD after receiving the PC. Was told by support RAM could be bad and they can replace it but I need to pay for shipping. I spent a day to do the mem86test and each of the sticks passed the test. Then support told me to reinstall windows and they claimed it is a software problem. After I reinstall windows, I found  wifi and Bluetooth not functioning . After 1 day of getting on the phone and emails backs and forth I was told to have my BIOS updated. I have never purchased a pre-assembled PC before, after this very bad experience from CyberPowerPC I would never purchase from them again or recommend anyone to do so. This is far from a worry-free experience, and their QC did not catch any of these before they ship the machine is just astonishing.

We were shipped a computer that we paid 3000.00 USD that was not working and kept crashing/blue screen every hour.  We had to pay an additional 1200.00 to have a local computer repair shop trade out the mother board, power supply, get the bios working and provide a functioning windows os.  I have tried to contact their repair dept who wasnt helpful at all told us to pay out of our pocket and we would be reimbursed.  But now when asking for reimbursement we are not getting any response.  DO NOT BUY FROM THIS COMPANYMay 17th*Response to CyberPower:  We have not received any refund or any response until I left this review.  Please email me and show me when the refund will be processed.

Review.Titre: The packaging was very difficult to…
Review.Contenu: The packaging was very difficult to remove, causing one of the rigid tubes to be dislodged. When I finally was able to fix it the water pump didn’t work. I don’t know if some of the fluid spilled from the tube is the culprit. Some fluid also landed on the gpu. In addition, the rigid tubes are very uneven. I’m considering sending it back. Bottom line is that it has never worked. It sucks for a 3000 dlls pc

Review.Titre: Returning a PC due to being damaged on…
Review.Contenu: Returning a PC due to being damaged on delivery. Customer service regarding this is has been a joke. Originally was going to just send it in for repairs, but at this point I don't want to own a CyberPower PC due how horrible their customer service has been. If I spoke to their sales department prior to placing the purchase I wouldn't have boughten from them in the first place due to their horrible customer service. All this experience has left me with is 4 weeks without my new PC which I'm buying elsewhere and a $70 return fee. 30 day money back guarantee my ass. I could go into even more depth with this situation, but even this has been a further waste of my time. BUYERS BEWARE, good product (own a 6 year old model of theirs, and wanted to be a returning customer), terrible service and customer relations.

Review.Titre: Poor communication, bait and switch tactics
Review.Contenu: Ordered a RTX 4090 Tracer VII system on the memorial day sale, total about $2700.24 hours later, rep emails me they confirm the order and will begin processing.3 hours after that, I get an email saying they cancelled my order due to their "fraud department," flagging the transaction,I email back asking for clarification,No responseCall today,They wont give any further information, other then I should order using another method, not a credit card (:-O) Now, I have 8 different credit cards, and perfect credit, so this seems a bit strange, but okay, fine.Conveniently, the price has increased by $150. ;-)No, they won't place the order again on the original pricing. They can't "help" me.Seems a bit shady to me, like a bait and switch ;-)If the support is this bad before the purchase, I fear what will happen afterwards. Perhaps I should count myself lucky.

This has been one of my all-time worst experiences with getting a new computer. I have had this thing for less than 3 months and I have taken it apart and put it back together more times than I care to think about. (over a hundred times already) Why this company does not test the whole computer when it is built and before they send it out? instead, they only test individual parts. This is absolutely lazy and a terrible business plan that has ensured customers like me steer new customers away from this business. Neer 3 months fighting something that should have worked when I got it. Very disappointing.

Ive bought 5 Cyberpower PCs since 2013.All but the first one Ive had to send back sue to hardware issues and of those 4 Ive had to send back 3 were DOA on day 1.  One of those took an additional 3 months of shipping back and forth before it was in proper working condition.Noe once they were fixed they were good machines that servered me for a number of years.However, its very frustrating from a customer standpoint and in the future I will probably not be buying from Cyberpower when it comes time to replace these newest two.

Review.Titre: Expensive pc to not be able to use it
Review.Contenu: Expensive pc to not be able to use it, since they forgot the whole keyboard.

Review.Titre: My PC would not turn on
Review.Contenu: My PC would not turn on. Now I have to send the machine in for repairs with an apparent dead power supply as my friend was unable to spark the PC to life. It's just a huge bummer to be waiting for a gaming PC only to have it not run once it arrives.

I had issues with my GPU I purchases. I reached out to Cyberpower for product support and only received an automated response. 24 hours later I receive a follow up e-mail from Cyberpower saying that they'd love to hear what I think of their customer service. Welp, so far I think the service is terrible. I submitted a support request about a defective GPU and got an automated response back called "Questions about your gift card". A gift card and a graphics are completely different. Now I'm stuck with a GPU that black screens and crashes frequently with no support from the place I bought it from.

Selected a graphics card in a full PC build that was advertised in the main heading as coming with a copy of Diablo 4. I selected "Order as is, make no customization changes" and proceded to payment. Now, the day after I received the PC and realized the code wasn't in the packaging, I email support and they're trying to convince me I didn't "opt into" the free bundle. Unacceptable, and portends of who knows what other unreliable bait and switch techniques on the back end.

Review.Titre: This was the worst experience I have…
Review.Contenu: This was the worst experience I have ever had. Paid extra for shipping faster, paid extra for faster assembly time, paid extra for safe packing of the computer with extra foam or whatever. Only to be given a box that had a bootprint, several large box dents, several impact holes from something piercing the box, and a shattered water cooling system that flooded the case, the packaging, and the box to the point of it being water damaged and cardboard layers coming apart from each other. Now I am being charged to get a refund, after lost time and money. Super bad customer service, and they made no attempt to remedy the situation. Just being met with derision.

Review.Titre: Received back from repair still broken
Review.Contenu: Received back from repair still broken. Company would not do anything to compensate or expedite to be sent back for repair a second time despite being a large customer of theirs.

Appalling to be honest. We bought a gaming pc with a 3060ti graphics card, 1tb ssd intel core i5,16 gb of ram from costco. After 9 months it stopped working saying no signal and costco wouldn't replace or take the return. We had to contact cyber power to send it back to them. The 1st customer service advisor I spoke to was arrogant which led to me speaking to a manager who agreed to get the pc collected amd fixed the fault. However over the space of the next 6 months the same problem happened twice. Look at the reviews on YouTube.as a parent that didn't really know much about pcs, the general opinions I found was quite similar. Really good specs for the money but all other components poor and cheap quality

Computer arrived with a misaligned motherboard so half the plugs were unusable without us sending it back in or fixing it ourselves, So we refunded it. It was supposed to be a gift, just ruined the fun and mood.

Review.Titre: Worst purchase experience I’ve had in a long time.
Review.Contenu: The PC was broken on arrival and had multiple parts missing and a driver error. After spending two days on the phone with support and finding every solution to be useless (one of their suggestions actually ended up making the situation worse) I stopped calling support and started doing my own research and was able to discover and resolve the issue in a few hours. Of course CyberpowerPC provided no customer service and said that I’d have to send it in for repairs which would take months. I will never purchase from them again and warn everyone I know to never use this business.

Pc didn’t work. Looping BIOS screen. Turns out the SSD fell out. I can’t get it back in and if I am shipping it back to get fixed I want a refund instead. I’ll buy a pc from somewhere else that doesn’t deliver broken stuff

i could give it 5 stars if it didn't come with a problem with the hard drive. I need to bring it back to have it reseated or replaced. other than that, everything else is fine but since i can't use it at all until this issue is resolved, means how can it be anything else than 1 star.

Review.Titre: The PC I purchased arrived damaged
Review.Contenu: The PC I purchased arrived damaged.  They jammed the foam padding in so hard that it bent the video card fan housing so now when the PC runs it sounds like a chainsaw.  I contacted support at CyberPowerPC and they didnt even respond.  Having purchased a total of 3 PCs from CyberPowerPC I can assure you this will be the very very last.  Horrible service and I learned my lesson I guess.After the response from CyberPowerPC below I attempted to contact support again.  They are still useless.  They would rather argue with me than send a replacement video card.  They won’t accept responsibility for a mistake when packaging it for shipping.  I stand by never using them again for prebuilt PCs.

My package was stolen interally, you guys rerouted my package to the wrong address and forged a signature. The forged signature didn't even forge my full name just last name. I've filed a police report

My package was RTS, and the communication was low quality and untrust worthy. I could have paid a friend for a trip to microcenter, built a PC on the spot and be done with this headache, but instead I'm multiple weeks in still waiting for a package that will likely not arrive. I'm frustrated and over the process and want a resolution or a full refund.

When I received my computer, immediately began to show over heating issues where the cpu would hit around 100C and climb until finally shutting down. Spent some money to have a local tech identify the issue to which it was to be the case as the culprit. Once the face plate was removed the temperatures began to remain stable. The idea that this was not identified before shipping out the computer my way blows my mind. A simple stress test would of displayed abnormal temperatures and should of been looked into before shipping to me.The other thing that was a great experience was after a month of ownership the PSU that came with the pc blew up. Thankfully it didn’t take any other components with it but the stress and nonsense I had to go through to get a pre built back in a condition where I could actually use it was a lot. I will never order one again.

Review.Titre: Old refurbished fan in my New pc !!!
Review.Contenu: The computer arive wath a beautiful day !!! But the pcu fan is full of grease and dust !!! Like if they refurbished old component and they sel it like they new !!!the tech from cyberpower tell me to start removing the fan from the cpu  on send them back in California at me fée for analyse and juste dont ave computer for few month ...I use a 137 q-tip to clean all that grease the fan trow every were inside the pc wath a wonderful day

Bought a CyberPower computer from Amazon and am in the process of returning it.  It started up fine but no signal from the monitor.  So I checked the video card and it was seated properly, fans and lights working but still no signal.  So I tried my son’s monitor - no signal then tried a spare monitor we keep on hand but no signal.  Called their service department and the tech lady told me to do what had just been done.  This was my first ready made computer but, with this experience, it will be my last.  I also, after speaking with her looked online and found out that I wasn’t the only one having this problem with them.  Searching this turned up many complaints about this issue with their computers.

Review.Titre: Didn’t work right out do the box
Review.Contenu: Didn’t work right out do the box. The GPU is non-functional. I find it hard to believe this was an issue that occurred in shipping. I removed it and reseated it, everything appears intact and non-damaged. I have already contacted support asking for a return and refund.

Absolutely horrible. Received a pre-built PC that stopped working within 12 hours because the GPU “failed” or some bs. Sent it back to get repaired and after getting it back the PC still doesn’t work. Pathetic.

Review.Titre: Non-functioning Computer and Slow Customer Service
Review.Contenu: I've bought several computers from CyberPowerPC, and I've never had any serious issues until this time. My computer was completely dead when I got it. After 40+ minutes talking with Tech Support, I was told that I needed to send the machine back for repairs. I wouldn't have been upset so much if they had refunded my RUSH! service cost that I paid to get the computer to me quicker, or if they would have paid for faster shipping to-and-from the company, but they didn't do either. It took several days to get the computer back to them, and it looks like several more days yet to come before I'll receive it. This process is bad Customer Service, in my opinion, although the technician was very nice and helpful.
Awful customer service. Won’t send normal size Label for RMA so I can’t print it out— refuses to offer any support to fix this, sent a DOA graphics card NEVER BUY FROM THEM

Review.Titre: I received a broken computer due to…
Review.Contenu: I received a broken computer due to lack of protective packaging. Trying to get that issue resolved with cyber PC is very frustrating the people that email with are very unhelpful to the point I considered bouncing the charge and sending it back to sender. The people on the phone are mostly unprofessional and argumentative. Also I paid extra to have to computer shipped out quicker and it shipped 8 business days after the expected ship date with zero explanation. Over unhappy with my experience dealing with Cyber PC and almost two months later still don't have a PC

Review.Titre: The computer didn't work when I…
Review.Contenu: The computer didn't work when I received it and customer service is a pain to get a hold of if you work a full time job. Probably going to have to just refund the whole thing, which means I'm still going to be out some money since they apparently don't cover the shipping back to them.

Review.Titre: To be fair I've had 2 experiences
Review.Contenu: To be fair I've had 2 experiences, the first was completely without issues, the second however was an eye opener.  My computer shipped with no testing of the graphics card, the plastic was still on it.  After the plastic was removed the computer booted, everything appeared fine for 2 days.  Then nothing displayed.  Getting help was impossible the phone wasn't answered and my emails were answered once a day.  With the clock ticking on the warranty, I was forced to ship the computer back (at my cost) since no one approved a return.  Eventually the computer was repaired and sent back.  I would advise anyone who wants a cyberpower pc to purchase it through best buy where at least you can get service.  It's unlikely I would buy another from them.

GPU - Dead on arrival.  Company didn't seem to really care about the impact on me.  Took them 2 days to figure out how to take my credit card to do an advance RMA.  Hopefully the new card works when I receive it.Asked for a slight credit or perhaps upgrade and was told no, didn't even try and uplift my poor experience with them.  They were the cheapest price out there and now I know why.

Review.Titre: I am still waiting on my PC to be…
Review.Contenu: I am still waiting on my PC to be delivered. The one I sent back arrived Friday and your facility was meant for another buyer. Where is my pc? I paid 1253 and still don't have any my deliveryissue (#1236319). I sent the proper docs and returned the wrong equipment. Cyberpower needs to send the correct product out.What is the status of my order?

Review.Titre: Bought a pre-built unit and got a…
Review.Contenu: Bought a pre-built unit and got a defective power cord and hdmi port so I can't even use the unit customer service does not respond in a timely manner or at all. Had to buy a replacement power cord due to the lack of effort from your customer service department. Now I'll probably have to wait even longer for an replacement hdmi port which I'll probably end up having to buy myself due to the laziness of the customer service department.
All around horrible. Bare minimum on trying to resolve customer issues. Never recommending y’all. Lucky I don’t throw this piece of garbage in the trash. 2500 buck wasted!
Never buy from this store, they are ship totally not working PC, and not accepted return, I don't know why this guys still working in the USA market. NEVER recommended for all.

Review.Titre: Sold me a incompatible computer and didn't even bother to test it before shipping.
Review.Contenu: They sold me a computer with incompatible parts. When I fixed the issue myself (because their support is awful) and asked that I be refunded for the RAM that was not compatible with my processor, they informed me that I would need to pay for my own shipping/packaging of the hardware for return.I will not be using this company ever again.

Review.Titre: Computer had issues two days after…
Review.Contenu: Computer had issues two days after receiving. GPU is on RMA, but I am concerned about the GPU not being the issue and falling out of my refund period, and being stuck with a dud of a computer. Also not looking forward to having RMA every single component just to trouble shoot what the issue is.It is pretty upsetting spending three thousand dollars on something that isn't working and not receiving much customer service when I am having issues makes me not want to return as a customer or recommend Cyberpower.

Review.Titre: After purchasing the computer I have…
Review.Contenu: After purchasing the computer I have had nothing but problems with it. Issues within the first month of turning it on. Replaced the ram through RMA and then it went back to having blue screen issues after another month. Had to pay to send it in for RMA $150 shipping. Paid over $3000 for the PC. The RMA to fix the issue took 18+ days to “run tests” I had already ran prior to sending it in. Was a bad motherboard. The support turn around time is a joke. Won’t be purchasing another CyberPower PC again.

Review.Titre: I recieved my $5k PC and it didn't…
Review.Contenu: I recieved my $5k PC and it didn't work.  Had to spend an additional $300 to find out that they shipped the PC with a bad Power Supply and they attached a metal bracket with an attached hard drive and it was shorting my motherboard without protecting it.  Now I have a hard drive I can't use.  Also, the D4 game code doesn't work at all.  Very poor..would not recommend.  They need to make this right.

Cancelled my order without reaching out to verify the purchase was legit. Only communication was from me emailing them for an update which was they they told me he cancelled my order. As a 2x returning customer I’ll never buy from them again

Review.Titre: Computer hasn't worked from the beginning.
Review.Contenu: Since I got the computer it hasn't worked, now I returned a defective GPU and one month later customer service says they're still "testing it". Can you believe it!!!! It's being a nightmare from the beginning with this "company ". They do everything in their power to make it difficult to return defective items not to mention to make a complaint,  but you'd be wasting your time to do so because there is NOBODY within this "company "to complain to or anybody to be in charge to resolve this kind of situations. Now, I have a brand new expensive computer just sitting in my desk completely useless. But I can tell you guys, this was my last time buying something from this so called "company". And no, I DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING COMPUTERS FROM THIS "COMPANY". Look elsewhere 😤.

Review.Titre: PC not working and no one helped
Review.Contenu: Received the PC dented. The graphics card is defective and I've emailed like 4 times, twice from their website and no answer. I paid so much money for this pc and all the payment hassle and now I have a defective equipment is not worth it at all.

Change there return policy.  My computer that arrived not working will not be replaced.  We have to pay to return the poor product.  After buying 7 computers in the past from you - you have lost a couple customers.  Guidelines on how to write a review?

I ordred the PC to be rushed, they didn't tell me that the motherboard was on back order and would still take a week. When it finally arrived it worked for about 5 minutes and then the OS had a hard fail and had to be installed. After the reinstall it turned out the motherboard is bad as it wouldn't find the wi-fi or ethernet even when directly plugged in. Worked with customer service and were given the options of a repair taking 6-8 or a refund taking about 3-4 weeks. Not happy about the service or the fact it never really worked. Basically I gave them a short term loan. Maybe others will have better luck but just understand if something goes wrong it will take a min of a month to get it fixed or refunded.

Review.Titre: I was sent a faulty PC
Review.Contenu: I was sent a faulty PC and had to return it the next day. They were multiple BSOD crashes a day. Now I have to wait half a month for the repair process to be finished. Absolutely disheartened by this experience. I spent 2k for nothing.

Got my prebuilt computer. It arrived in good shape but after getting games installed that is when the problems started to show themself. First major problems. Screens going black during streaming seasons. Even when streaming just an app it would still freeze and go black. When I called I got told that they could not send me a box & packaging material to send back the defective video card. They said I could send it back but I would need to provide everything to do that and if something happened in transit I would be at fault for that. So I tried to find a work around and no matter who I talked to I got the same answer. The very next week one of the ports on the video card went out and was sending corrupted data to my monitor. I called again and still no assistance. How hard can it be to send an empty box for the product they sent me. To you I ask this, how is that a good customer experience?
Nothing was resolved. I was pretty much told tough luck that I was given the incorrect card despite the model being explicitly listed on the product page, in the cart, and in the emailed invoice.

Review.Titre: I ordered a computer from you guys over…
Review.Contenu: I ordered a computer from you guys over a month ago. It arrived with a defective motherboard. I then sent it back and 2 weeks later have heard nothing. I called and was told the part was on back order.  I asked if I could change to a different part and pay the difference and was told no. No idea when I will receive a computer so I will be contacting my credit card company.

Bad experience with these guys. They sent me a non working computer after a week of reaching out to them I contacted Bobby (he did a good job) who I delt with me when purchasing the system got back to me and things got rolling. I returned the PC for them to fix the issue and when it finally returned to me it was the same exact issue I had the first time. No signal on my monitor. I'm sure these guys didn't test it or fixed the issue and just sent me back the same pc with the same parts. Just with better packaging the second time around. These guys don't know what they are doing and I went to ibuypower and paid a little more but when it came in it did exactly what it suppose to and turn on when it's plugged in. My advice don't buy from cyberpower and go elsewhere.

Review.Titre: the build i purchased had a defective…gpu
Review.Contenu: the build i purchased had a defective gpu, replacement was sent 2 weeks later, wrong one waited another 2 weeks for a cable from psu to gpu only to find out the second gpu was bad

Review.Titre: Computer crashing with blue screen upon arrival
Review.Contenu: Computer crashing with blue screen upon arrival. Some hardware issue with the memory that seems to be severe. I thought they would have at least checked the computer before sending it.

I can't comment on the PC itself because I haven't received it yet. My order was filled extremely quickly and shipped sooner than expected, which was great -- but it was shipped to the wrong address and has been sitting under a UPS claim for the past ten days (and counting). As for the status of that claim, CyberPower has been completely silent, providing absolutely no information whatsoever, while I've paid for a PC that is either sitting in a bin somewhere or is being used by whomever signed for it. Either way, CyberPower seems determined to keep me in the dark. They have refused to cancel the order or spec a new machine to send to me while their shipment snafu is worked out, which is disappointing to say the least. The PC itself might be fantastic---I'm a repeat customer and they've been great in the past---but their customer service is non-existent at best. If you buy a PC from them, pray that your shipping is trouble-free!

Customer service was cold and unempathetic to my situation. C/S was not willing to work with me to help my situation. Tech support can't remote into system to help. Tech support unwilling to do telephone walk through. I was told I was only allotted 15 minutes of time when I called in and this is why they could not help me and requested I send my system to have parts replaced. While this is most likely the best solution. I was still never upset by the customer service provided.

Review.Titre: A company that obviously does not stand behind their product
Review.Contenu: The basic components of the system were great, and the value excellent.  Where it all went wrong was the build quality, attention detail and total lack of customer service.  The PC arrived with a damaged chassis, terrible cable routing, poorly fastened components, in particular the water cooler which was only mounted on one side.  Mailed in this state, the water cooler torqued on the mounts and bent the tabs.  Fans did not work, and RGB was not set-up out of the box,  the IO did not align properly due to the chassis damage.  My request to CPPC was simple, please send me new chassis and I will transfer the components myself.  I did not want to send the system back, I did not ask for a partial refund, I asked for a chassis and I would do the work.  In the month since, I have not received any response to my warranty request or any subsequent follow-up.  I have since bought my own chassis, moved everything and properly assembled it myself ensuring it would work…something CPPC should have done in the first place.  Terrible attention to detail, poor quality control and the worst customer service/tech support I have ever experienced.  I’m 200.00 more out of pocket to fix this thing, I guess I am lucky it works at all considering how this was put together.

Review.Titre: Company shipped an unusable pc in its…
Review.Contenu: Company shipped an unusable pc in its current form. They recommended parts that were not compatible then refused to apologize for all the stress and frustration. I eventually was able to fix the issue myself while support offered little to no help. Recommending my friends and anyone else to avoid this company and get a pc from somewhere else.

Review.Titre: The hard drive wasn’t secured into the…
Review.Contenu: The hard drive wasn’t secured into the expansion bay and was loose, not connected to the bay. The bay where it was located was also unwired but the empty bay next to it was wired with nothing in it.
Good product, Horrible customer service. Victor needs to be taught how to answer a question and not be rude.

Delay in parts. Parts ordered replaced with less expensive parts. Not compensated for difference. Took over two weeks longer than anticipated to receive. No communication on delays. I had to email to see why things were taking so long.

Everything is good, the computers look amazing, but two issues we noticed.  Although we got the most powerful computers we thought we were getting, totaling abour $8000, the computer came without wireless, which we thought was strange, we didn't know to double check for that, we thought all computers came with wireless these days.  Another issue is that when my little boys play video games, the games play lagging and not in HD, although we have everything set up to high performance.  The lagging is annoying, and my boys prefer to use their old CLX computers, which, although are not nearly as powerful as these cyberpower computers, they came with wireless and the games are not lagging.
No quality control. PC death on arrival due to CPU power not connected, CPU thermal paste not applied although it was paid as extra, a rip off

I will update if I receive anything from customer service. Went to set up my PC only to find that I can't turn it on. Couldn't tell you if there's anything wrong with it though. They didn't give me a power supply cord so I'm unable to plug it in or test it. However, it's very pretty. Glad I paid extra for the cord management.

Review.Titre: I paid extra for extra shipping foam to…
Review.Contenu: I paid extra for extra shipping foam to protect the inside of the PC. The 3 days I had my PC, I experienced screen tearing, artifacts on the screen, games crashing. Now I have to send in my GPU to get a new one. I had to pay for shipping and insurance on the GPU. So $20 for the extra protect, and $66 for shipping/insurance. That's $86 for a mistake that wasn't caused by me. I'm also having to wait 2 weeks until I can actually use my PC again. This is extremely frustrating...

Fans were installed incorrectly. There were no intake fans all were set to exhaust. Pc had cooling issues. Had to reinstall and also order additional fans to install because not enough could be bought the website.

Review.Titre: Disappointed with lack of response to problems
Review.Contenu: everal days ago I responded to their e-mail asking how they did with my order. Included a photograph of the keyboard that arrived with a damaged cable connection and ask how to proceed. They have yet to respond.I have to assume they are either understaffed to the point of not being able to respond, or don't read the solicited responses

The free software that I chose (Warhammer) was no longer available and I had to get another (Marvel Midnight Suns). They were unable to get me the software I ordered. I would suggest installing the software before it ships or provide the code to the customer to download BEFORE it expires/ships. *UPDATE* I have tried to get the code, but your company said the code for Warhammer expired and I HAD to choose another game. Please remedy this or provide me the code I need for the game. Thank ou.

Review.Titre: Willis B. Needs lots of employee to customer to training
Review.Contenu: I absolutely love my new gaming cpu thats 5 out of 5 stars. However, overall experience is 2 stars because of Willis B.   He is the rudest person i have ever spoken to at a business that i continued patronage with.  If i didn't trust i was getting a great cpu i would have never purchased it all because of how rude Willis B. was.

When I ordered this pc, I chose a corsair case, to go with my corsair peripherals so I'm using icue for all my lighting. You don't give an option to specify ram and send gskill ram that I have to control with asus software which is terrible. I asked to do a ram swap and heard nothing. I followed up again in Sept and was told I was outside the 30-45 refund policy. So when i upgrade I'll have a stick of used ram I didn't want, and have to toss it or sell it for a fraction of its cost.

I am happy with the computer I received. The updates be email were great. They were willing to answer any questions I had. The PC arrived well packaged and in a timely manner. The problem is that the card I used (which I haven't used in over 6 months), began to have random charges show up immediately on it IE: subscription services, and food orders... The phone number I used now gets 15+ spam calls a day. I had to cancel the card and now I am going to have to change my number, which is inconvenient because I use it for work. The computer is great but the aftermath with my personal information is unforgivable. Try to do better!

Review.Titre: I ordered a 7900 XTX with a i9 13900k
Review.Contenu: I ordered a 7900 XTX with a i9 13900k , I should have virtually no issues. The computer gets blue screens and crashes a lot, when it’s in sleep mode and I wake it up , it crashes lol. One of the bottom pieces that holds the computer up came completely broken off the case when I opened it. IT CAME BROKEN. You would think paying the prices you do they would be more careful and attentive with their computers. Surprisingly though I haven’t had a problems with it overheating. Just crashing for literally no reason.

Packaging was well put together but MOBO failed after 3 days. In hindsight, MOBO started to fail since day 1. USB power started to progressively fail until, ultimately, it was not working at all. No computer does not even boot up. Custer Service was very responsive and attentive. Awaiting repair now.

Review.Titre: My computer arrived later than expected…
Review.Contenu: My computer arrived later than expected and damaged. The hdmi port at the video card slot didn’t work. Instructions in the box were very, very light. The instructions weren’t specified to the specific computer I bought too. For the hdmi port issues, I had to send it back for warranty repairs. With the warranty repairs, I won’t have my computer for another month. Customer service was okay. They were willing to provide status updates during the building process and when I had to report that my computer wasn’t working.

Review.Titre: No working lights, no QA checks...
Review.Contenu: The PC arrived with no working case lighting, including the case fans, or AIO cooler. At least one fan does not work correctly. Had to reinstall Windows after the first start because several files were missing from the operating system. Couldn't open a browser without DLL errors. The top part of the case was rattling loose upon arrival. Might be shipping, or an oversight. There seems to have been no quality checks prior to shipping. At least the parts appear accurate, so two stars.*Support now says it can be sent back for service. I'll update the review with how that goes.

The delivery options were very inflexible. I was forced to call in and then send an email to change them so that I could actually get my package. As soon as I hooked up my new PC it very quickly started making a clicking noise so I had to return it for repairs. At this rate it'll be more than 2 months since ordering this PC before I'll be able to even use it. This is incredibly disappointing compared to my previous experience.

I had some tech issues, and the company wasn’t exactly helpful with any of it. The quality of the pc seems pretty low, considering the price, and simple things such as my lights turning on don’t even work and are constantly malfunctioning. I’d recommend spending a little bit more, and getting a PC from almost anywhere else.

Not bad....just annoyances I'm finding throughout. WiFi is awful (even with antennas) Bluetooth has the range of my pinky, went to upgrade and get an extra SSD and welp...they forgot to include the m2 screw on the motherboard. Every day I find some irritating detail like this and it's getting on my nerves

Review.Titre: Don't be surprised by damaged PC
Review.Contenu: PC arrived with scratches, dents, and scrapes. Packaging was entirely intact, so it was definitely mishandled in production or I was given a returned case. Customer support took their time to get back to me. They offered to have me send it back for a replacement case, but I'm not sure how it got through quality control like that. I was offered a courtesy shipping label only after I asked if shipping costs would be reimbursed. Denied a refund on just the case, which would have been acceptable to me. Sending it back wasn't worth the hassle on my end because it's only cosmetic issues. PC runs well, but I'm disappointed with lack of care put into providing a quality product for a $3k sale

-PC Shipped late. Not ideal but not a major issue either. -PC was supposed to have 6000 mhz DDR5 ram, came with 4800 instead (and wrong brand too). This come across as deceptive as the average user probably doesn’t know how to check their ram speed. Customer service is in the process of helping me, will adjust review depending on the outcome.

Review.Titre: I had some questions early on about PC…
Review.Contenu: I had some questions early on about PC configuration after ordering.  I emailed and called direct.  Response I got check your order/send email request.  Staff that I directly talked to on the phone were abrupt and short.   Although we got the PC with the eventual change I requested (and paid extra for), I will not recommend your company to anyone else looking to purchase a PC.

I had ordered a new PC because it seemed to be a better price than what was available here in Canada at the time. The problem was that the Motherboard seemed to have a defect where it wouldn't recognize the two ram sticks that I had ordered, and CyberPower would look to fix it, just it would cost me another 500 buck to have it shipped back to me in Canada. So not worth any repairs since it wasn't covered.

I ordered a custom build PC, and while it was assembled and shipped in a timely manner, it was evident that there was no QA/QC as the front bracket containing the AIO radiator was not secured at all, allowing the AIO radiator to hang freely throughout the entirety of shipment.These are the kinds of things people pay experts to avoid, especially on $3000+ gaming PCs. I was able to ship back the PC for a full refund, no questions asked, hence the 2 stars.

Review.Titre: The QA needs a lot of work
Review.Contenu: The QA needs a lot of work.  Ordered a three set fan with controller the fans are connected to the control box but the cables to the motherboard to give monitoring and allow for lighting effects was not even installed and is not even present in the pc itself.  Most the mounting screws for the graphics card and expansion slots were not installed allowing it to flop around freely luckily there was no damage to the card itself.  The inside of the pc looks like a birds nest very few of the wires were tied back and wire organization done.  The PC itself looks great and does operate without issues but had to do some clean up myself to ensure long term use.

Review.Titre: The RGB lights aren't fully set up
Review.Contenu: The RGB lights aren't fully set up, they cant be controlled and are stuck on a blinking rainbow pattern. Its missing a wire

I received my computer, plugged everything in and no display. Open it up to find the graphics card not connected. Tab covering the case access screw was really brittle and broke as soon as I tried to remove it. Warranty voided, just like that.  Then it started overheating immediately. Why there was no fan in the power supply, I don't know. I sent it back the next day and didn't get it back for over a month. Also received again with the graphics card disconnected. I received meaningless email after email. Fortunately, the machine itself works fine now, but the customer service was lackluster, to put it nicely. Will not purchase from again or recommended to anyone.

Review.Titre: Final product is good, the journey not so much
Review.Contenu: I ordered an EVO MINI I 300 system with an msi mb and 4070ti graphics card. The card was not in stock when it was sold to me, evidently. First I found out about it was when I contacted them two weeks after I ordered and was told the GPU hadn't been shipped AGAIN. I was told I could wait until the next shipment or get a refund and start over. I chose to wait the extra week.I got a email a little over a week later telling me my GPU won't fit in the case. It's STILL an option for that case/system in the builder, I just checked. My system runs beautifully but it  had to be put into a larger case. If I'd known that I'd have built differently, I'm a returning customer but I may not be again.

Review.Titre: Quality Department not doing their job
Review.Contenu: When I Received the laptop, the speakers did not work, contacted tech support and per their instructions, unistalled the drivers and reinstalled them. speakers still did not work, contacted support again and still did not work.  took the laptop to local repair shop and they were able to get the speakers to work, however ended up costing me 75 dollars, now the touchpad does not work.  I do not blame the support people for this, I do however blame their quality control department for allowing this product to be shipped.  Quality if done properly would of caught this and in my opinion would of never allowed this laptop to be shipped.

I spent over 4200$ on a new PC to eventually he told the case isn’t big enough. After numerous emails and lack of status updates trying to figure out what to do, they eventually changed my order to a random case I didn’t want (which took over a month I think). I requested they charge me for the bigger case since it would be easier, but I wasn’t not given that option. Some of the acrylic custom loop tubes were also bent, and the CPU water block has debris swooshing around noisily and what looks like mold inside of it. I’ll just change the custom loop and eat the 246$ cost of it, and have a professional redo it. Despite this, PC does function as intended and without issue (aside from loud noise from debris in custom loop)
why haven't you re-shipped the computer, i've responded every time, ship, ship ship!

Everything was great, but when my pc arrived the gpu was dead, so I had to send my pic back to get fixed. I didn’t get offered any kind of fast shipping or expedited service. I understand things happen, but I don’t feel like for the amount of money I spent the response to the dead gpu was underwhelming, all this aside the build was quick and got delivered fast. Sells kept me up to date all the way but repair hasn’t said anything.
Shipping was relatively quick, but packing was inadequate.  PC was damaged on arrival. Bottom was dented in and front panel was snapped off.  A $2000 PC should have been packaged with more care.
Poor communication, ignored instructions.  Parts forced to fit, even slightly bent.  Hard drive installed wrong, loose and crooked.  Good price and parts selection.  Shipped safe, worked out-of-box.

This was my first time buying a custom-built PC and I spent about 3700$ for a high-end PC.Right out of the box, there were a few problems. The intake fans were all placed backward, which is about the worst thing you can do for airflow. It was also missing half the fans and all the hard drive screws. These were unique screws that should have came with the case so I didn't have any lying around.I sent an email to customer support, who replied after a few days that they would ship the missing fans and screws to me, but only half of the missing screws arrived, and still no fan.Overall I would not buy from CyberPowerPC again. I paid for a custom-built PC hoping to avoid potential build mistakes, but now I have to go through the entire PC to make sure everything was installed correctly.

I've had problems with the computer I bought since it arrived. Some of the fans work, some don't, making it overheat and shut down randomly, even after sending it in for repairs. This will be the second time I'm sending it in since December.Customer service is helpful, and the process of sending it for repairs is fairly easy, at least.

Review.Titre: The desktop was dead on arrival
Review.Contenu: The desktop was dead on arrival. Regardless of paying extra for expanding foam protection to keep components in place, the video card was apparently too heavy and needed further support. The unit arrived with the PCI slot (supporting the video card) damaged. The PCI connection was spread apart enough to disallow a connection. The motherboard was also probably damaged. The weight of this card warrants extra support to avoid this issue in the future.Afterward, their support team took a couple of days to supply a return shipment label. After shipped back, I was told it might take weeks before return. Thankfully, they did ship it back within about a week after they received it.My biggest complaint: I originally paid extra for 3 day shipping, but it was sent back UPS Ground. The tracking had an arrival date of August 31st. Understandably, the shipment was to FL during Hurricane Idalia... It moved through less than a day and expected a possible extra day to deliver. Well, Friday came, and then came notice it wouldn't be delivered until Sept 5th (because of worldwide weather), sorry... that's BS.Bottom line... Cyberpower should still have honored the 3 day expedited shipping I paid extra for the first time. And under the storm conditions, UPS shouldn't have been delayed more than a day. The order was placed on July 25th and it's now Sept 2nd and I'm still waiting on UPS to deliver!FWIW. This is my third computer ordered from Cyberpower, and was very happy with the first two orders, but a bit dissatisfied this time. The return time on a damaged unit received in shipment should receive better support and priority.

I paid extra for shipping to ensure my computer would arrive safely, but the fans on the inside arrived disconnected from the computer case frame with one of the fan frames cracked.  There are noticeably screws missing from fans that were to both hold the fans to the frame and the fans to the radiator.  I paid extra for wiring but found that some of the wires were ran between the case frame and the cover panels such that the wires were under compression when the cover to the computer case was closed.  The remaining wires were ran properly simply by running the wires through the slots in the frame provided.  I have reached out to Cyberpower, sent them pictures, but they have not offered to do anything about the problem.  Outside of that, its a good computer, but I selected to pay multiple upcharges to have this computer custom built and feel like I have been taken advantage of.

The computer was put together well except for the fans. I purchased a Corsair case and AIO cooler. The case came with three fans and the cooler came with two Elite fans. The build also said they would include three more Corsair fans. This is where things went wrong. To get all eight fans into the case they installed the cooler with a push / pull configuration. This was OK, but because the Corsair node only has room for six fans, which control the fan speed, they wired the other two fans from the power supply. This caused these other two fans to operate at full speed. Very noisy. They also put the "tach" wire from the Corsair cooler onto the AIO header. After contacting Corsair, they said the tach wire should go onto the CPU "fan" header. This wire is for telling the motherboard that there is cooling to the CPU. Then in bios, I reset the CPU fan from "ignore" to Monitor. I realize they were trying to include all the fans that were ordered, but they should have only added one more, not three.

Support has been responsive but the return process is slow and cumbersome. I have no idea when I’ll have the PC back. This review is about my experience so far. I have yet to power up the PC I ordered weeks ago so I have no info on how the computer actually performs.

Review.Titre: Build your own PC from scratch
Review.Contenu: The Good:-Computer runs great (now). I got a AMD Ryzen 5 7600 and 3060ti with 32GB DDR5 at 6000mhz with a 1tb NVME on an Asrock Micro MB with a hefty 850w. Computer runs quietly and cold with only one fan and the AIO CPU cooler.The Bad:-LOOONG time to get it built and shipped (more than a month), annoying when the receipt said only a few days.-RAM and CPU were not compatible at the speed it was at. Had to lower the RAM mhz to 5200 in BIOS because the 7600 can't reliably handle 6000.-Deal made it seem they were upgrading the RAM to 6000 over 4800, but it was just actually 4800mhz RAM that was overclocked.-PC was crashing every few minutes when under load because of this problem. So much for quality control.-No extra fans? Would think for the price paid they would at least throw in some fans for the intake, but no. I know it's an add-on you can pay for, but dude, fans are so cheap, and how can you send out a computer WITH OUT AN INTAKE FAN.All in all, I'm not really disappointed in the machine itself because the parts are good, but I've built my own machines my whole life, this being my first pre-built. I would rather build my own machine again next time knowing what I get is going to work properly. Having crashes right from the start because a company can't check if the RAM works properly is an absolute no. They need to educate their workers better.

Cyberpower sent a system to me that was delivered on August 9th.  There was no documentation or check list included and no AC power cord for the power supply.  There was also packing material so badly jammed between the GPU and cooler that it could not be removed without manually removing the Styrofoam from inside the packing material by hand.  While a tech support rep guided me (using a video link) through how best to disassemble the packing material, it was only because the material could not otherwise be removed without removing the cooler and GPU that he recommended removing the stryofoam. The power cord is still missing.  The tech support group at Cyberpower advised against using the cord from my existing system and of course using a cord other than the original would make relying on the warranty of the manufacturer of the power supply doubtful.  I have been told that it will ship in 7-10 days. The problem is that the company warranty only allows returns for a 30 day period during which a return can be done without paying a restocking fee, and a further 15 days to request any return.  The longer it takes to correct the failure to deliver the cord, the less time it allows to use the computer and determine whether there are any defects that would warrant returning it.  I have ordered at least 8 computers from system integrators over the years from several venders.  I have had defective parts and worked through warranty repairs.  But I have never before received a system lacking a component essential to using it.  I also never received a system that did not include some form of confirming checklist by the builder or a shipping department confirming all items included in the box.  I still have no clue how the system runs or how well the airflow was set up in the case.  System integrators cannot reasonably prevent a system from occasionally containing a defective part.  They should never just leave parts out altogether.  The experience has not inspired confidence.

Review.Titre: $3600 custom build.  Rookie build mistakes and poor cable management  Followed by an unwillingness to provide a warranted discount for said poor build quality.
Review.Contenu: Dear Sir, Ma'am, or whatever misguided pronoun you have chosen,I am writing regarding the order above and my displeasure with the condition in which it arrived.I'm including pictures attached to the email.I am a quadrapleic disabled veteran.  I had a 17-year career as a Data Center Hardware Engineer after leaving the U. S. Army before becoming 100% disabled by MS.  I'm not writing for a "Thanks for your service" or for pity.  I write this so you'll  know I know my tech but need hands to do the hardware for me.Once I received my order, I scheduled some tech friendly friends to come and install it for me.  Once it was powered on, the system booted successfully.  Because I no longer have the use of my hands, I use the Quadstick disability controller to operate my PC.Upon reviewing the devices installed in the system, I discovered the 8 TB 3.5" inch hard drive I ordered was not showing up.  This prompted a service call.  My techs worked with Adam and looked to troubleshoot the issue.  Adam asked for us to remove the right panel of the case.Once removed, the Corsair 5000D Airflow Case has an additional doorway that swings on hinges revealing the inner parts of the case.  We discovered the 8 TB drive was installed, but was not connected.  Now my PC installation became a PC repair, which the techy friends I had hired charged me additionally.Also, I found the cable management in the system to be a mess.  Even though the  Cyberpower tech that built my PC used cable tension sleeves on some of the cables, he/she/it has actually blocked the use of all three SSD drive trays thereby eliminating my ability to use them for future storage expandability.  I would need to pay a tech to completely rewire the PC just to use one of the trays in the future.I spent $3600 on this PC to be "Future proof".  So I wouldn't need to buy a new computer in the next 10 years or so.I had initially planned on upgrading my system storage with SSD's as the higher ratings become more affordable.  Though my motherboard has 2 other unused M.2 slots, the larger capacity M.2 drives are prohibitively expensive currently.I have neither the time nor the energy to have people come and box this thing up and ship it back to you to have it wired correctly.I do think it should be discounted since I had to pay my installers significantly more than I had planned since they had to actually repair my system instead of just installing it for me.  That and the blocking of my SSD trays cripples my storage options for the future and that's just unforgivable.Cyberpower PC's response?  Tough luck  Seeya!.  (Essentially)All in all, I designed a great system in their configurator.  They just took a dump on cable management and on customer service.I'll be reaching out to all of my techy friends and they'll be reaching out to all of their techy friends on social media that Cyberpower PC should be avoided.  I'll recommend a competitor like  Alienware, Digital Storm, or Falcon Northwest.
