I've ordered two machines through CyberPowerPC, and I have had vastly different experiences with each. The first, a light build with a 2000 series RTX, was perfect. The unboxing was satisfying, quick, and the machine had no issues with heavy use over the course of 2-3 years. The second machine; however, has been a massive pain with issues and multiple support tickets. The machine was much more powerful with a 3000 series RTX, and it worked very well when it was in working order. A couple months after heavy use the machine randomly had hardware errors that caused my monitors to stop getting feedback from the GPU, and since the CPU does not have integrated graphics the machine was practically unusable. My setup has worked flawlessly for many years and I have no reason to believe the machine issues are linked to any peripherals I am using, and even while I was troubleshooting I was able to run 4 other machines using the same setup without any problems. I worked with support and ended up spending $600 to ship the whole machine back to them in California for it to be fixed, and within 48 hours of the machine back in my hands the same issue was still happening, joy! I worked with support again and discovered that the issue goes away entirely with the use of a different graphics card. Through many months of troubleshooting, unseating hardware, and headaches, the problem still exists only with the GPU that came with the original build. I requested a replacement since none of diagnostic tests provided any useful information and I was told that I shouldn't assume the GPU is the issue and they would send it right back to me if it didn't test broken -- but my machine was broken when I sent it to them and they sent it back broken, so at this point who is to blame if it comes back and still doesn't work? Needless to say, I have gotten tired of constantly dealing with a faulty machine shipped to me twice by the company. I don't mean to be entirely negative for this review because the company impressed me enough the first time around to purchase a second build, and it must also be mentioned that support is very kind and patient when troubleshooting; however, I will not personally use this company for any future builds since I can no longer trust both the hardware they are sending out and the maintenance team's ability to truly diagnose and fix issues. I hope if you go with this company your experience is like my first machine and not like my second, but if it is the latter don't say I didn't warn you.

First I'll say the interface and purchasing is smooth as butter and I was very happy with the beginning of the process. I even got an email from a tech who stated the ETA and offered to help should I have any questions. After that is when it proceeded to go downhill. About 3 weeks had passed since my purchase so I went to the website portal to check the status and the information on there was not helpful at all, barely stating that I had even made a purchase. As I remembered the date I selected when making the purchase, I knew the date was less than a week out. I emailed the tech and was told the motherboard was on backorder and it would be another 2 or 3 weeks until they'd get it in. I know this is out of the company's control but maybe have a system in place to communicate this to the customer, without the customer having to reach out first, and to offer a substitution or something if they did not want to wait. I acknowledged the update from the tech and proceeded to wait, checking periodically for an update on the website. It was, I believe, the day before the date the backordered ETA was pushed to when I saw the ETA had been delayed even further and would be another week or so longer. Again, communicating this to the customer would be helpful. I decided to just wait until the new ETA date and see what happens. The date came and went without anything getting updated on the website so I decided to reach out to the tech again. I get back a largely blank page but with a simple date which it should ship by. Nice to know the motherboard came in, one can assume. From here it was picked up by UPS and I got an email with a tracking number. No idea why it proceeded to sit in a California warehouse for another week before being delivered but I feel like that's more a UPS issue than yours. At this point, I am just so overjoyed I finally have my PC in my possession. Packaging was mostly pretty good but something I found extremely odd was the paperwork and extra cables came in a completely random motherboard box which is a shame because I would have loved to display the actual box for the motherboard I am using. The cherry on top for this whole ordeal is after getting everything set up and some games installed, when I launched any given game, the whole PC would crash resulting in an error blue screen a few of the times. I had to troubleshoot online to try to figure out why the gaming PC I just purchased couldn't play any game I launched. Currently it seems underclocking the CPU has at least made it so I can play games but this should've been noticed if the PC was tested in any way based solely on the operating temperature. In summary, I would say the company needs to work on the service aspect of the process giving the customers more accurate updates on what's going on and maybe a bit more time testing the unit.

Review.Titre: Poor Customer Service & Some Build Issues
Review.Contenu: I saw that CyberPowerPC for their Labor Day Special was offering a good deal on building a PC with them. Having never used them to build a PC I was hesitant, but read some reviews and so I opted to build with them instead of assembling it myself, especially considering saving time and money because of the sale. I received the PC a little slower than I would have liked - almost 3 weeks, but upon opening my PC I was disappointed to see the first thing wrong - I ordered a PC with 3 RGB Corsair fans in front, as well as ordering the Corsair 4000D Airflow Case with the perforated front for air flow to be able to see the fans - the image on their website showed this case with my selection. Cyberpower PC sent the build inside the 4000D Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX case with the solid metal plate in front, obscuring view of the RGB fans, and not providing the airflow and aesthetic I wanted. So either the photo on the website was not accurate or they used the wrong case. Easy fix, but I had to pay extra to buy a replacement plate from Corsair to get what I wanted. This was the first disappointment.I also paid extra for the "professional" cable management, which was done well enough everywhere else, except in my PSU. The power supply I chose was fully modular, but they left the entire mess of unnecessary cables plugged it that aren't being occupied at all - they could have removed them, and the wiring will take me time to unravel, remove and then re-assemble - a service I specifically paid them more to take care of. Starting to feel more disappointed.I also received two game collection vouchers with this purchase, and one of them was well expired by the time I received my PC. Definitely expired before they had even shipped it. To top that all off - Cyberpower PC promised a $50 prepaid American Express Gift Card with the purchase. Upon opening the gift card and activating/checking the balance online, the card had already been used in an online gambling website, and had $4 left on it. I emailed Cyberpower about this and the other issues and was not replied to for over a week. I never received an email back, so I decided I had given them enough time and I called and was connected to Ryan at CyberPower PC on 10/10/22 at 12:25PM EST to find a solution to the issue, or to see if I should contact American Express. Ryan seemed to have 0 customer service experience and told me he would call me back - which he never did. I let it go because by this point, I can paint a picture of Cyberpower PC's incompetence and apathy, even if the gift card balance issue is not related to their service.As for the build itself, it works the way I need it to, apart from the GPU developing coil whine a few weeks after I received the PC. However, the building process, specials/sales disappointments, and customer service left a lot to be desired and I was left disappointed and unsatisfied with my experience with Cyberpower PC.

Review.Titre: So close to being a great experience, but failed.
Review.Contenu: TLDR; After 2 months I had to RMA for repair. On getting the PC back the expanding foam in the PC case damaged the motherboard or video card, and I had to troubleshoot it myself, again.Edit: So after a few months the power supply failed, it was so loud when it failed it was as if I took a hammer and hit the hood my of car as hard as I could. I requested an rma, and after some troubleshooting they took it on RMA.Not an issue, things happen. But when I got it back the computer didnt work, no video. Plug monitor into motherboard, and got video. Video card issue. During ship back from RMA the foam they used inside the PC case bent the video card. I called to make another RMA. Sent pictures. You can clearly see it's bent. I re-seat the card after OK from tech support. It starts to work.The computer turns off after 60 seconds every time. The power supply port on the graphics card seems damaged, if you touch the power going into the graphics card even very gently the PC turns off and fans run 100%. I buy a 90-degree adapter for the power cable. Seems to work to keep pressure off the cable. But still disappointing,  I am not happy at all, but cancel the RMA. The PCI-E slot, or the graphics card are bent. Functional  Been 2 months now since I got it back and only happened one more time.On to the original review.After a few bad reviews, I was worried about how the PC would come. But after a week with it, I'm fully satisfied.I bought the roughly 2350$ 13900k 4070ti base system. But after changing to the 990 Pro NVME and some other small items quickly became $2890A few main issues I was concerned about were damage, bios being configured correctly, proper seating of the CPU cooler (thermals) and fans not being plugged into the motherboard, and getting direct voltage.So after going through the PC thermals are great peaking at 80, and 60 ambient temps. Case fans are connected to the board so not always running at 100%, also the fan curve was just fine. Ram was running at correct speed, but I don't understand timings and voltage, so don't ask.Oh yea, zero damage. To remove expanding foam I had to pull a few power connectors. And that stuff was in there good, I had to break it off to get it out. But all good. No issues or debris.The keyboard they gave me for cheap is terrible. The mouse I paid an extra 14 dollars for is also terrible. Skip them and like someone else said reduce the e-waste because you will throw them out.Ordered on May 17, and received it on April 11. They told me ahead of time it would take 2-4 weeks for production, so if you minus the 4 days for UPS to deliver is very good.I didn't select a specific brand of 4070 ti I got a gigabyte eagle oc. Which I would have been happy with several brands. So I lucked out, this is one I'm happy with.The only thing I wish I would have changed would have to choose a name-brand power supply. It does work fine, but online many people complain they commonly are a failure issue. And since I spent $2900 I trusted they would sell me a good brand. If they told you what brand they put in the system by default I would have changed it for a mere $40-50 more, which is nothing compared to the total. As I said it's running just fine, even with my GPU and CPU pulling 500-600 watts for a bit. No crashing or anything like that.

I build many gaming systems in the past, but I purchased a $2000 pc because I was lazy and didn't have the time to make it myself. I learn my lesson I had nothing but issues with that computer. Bad ram, noisy fans, cheap CPU cooler, and PC runs hot, the power supply failed after a year. It seems like they get refurbished parts and used them for the PC builds.  I'm building my own going forward.

Review.Titre: Peace’s are loose in the back
Review.Contenu: Peace’s are loose in the back. Seems to be running right but only time will tell.
Pc showed up as DOA :( I paid $184 for shipping, for it show up DOA?
Pc is awful Wi-Fi connection, not useable without Wi-Fi right?

PROS:- easy to use website- straightforward process- great dealsCONS:- Fans were wired incorrectly. - Took quite awhile to unravel the rat's nest of wires to figure out which wires went to what. - A pin connector was completely destroyed and still used in my PC.- Missing several items that are supposed to be included in purchase - mobo screws, manuals, etc. Overall, I was hoping for a better experience, but will likely just order parts and build it myself next time. I don't see a reason to have someone slop it together for me

Review.Titre: Shipping was great, but problems with PC
Review.Contenu: Shipping was great. A problem I found a bit annoying is the cable management inside the pc. It was literally just a clump of a mess. Hard to unplug and plug anything in the power supply for upgrades when it’s cramp so tightly. Feel like I might break something if I touch it. Another issue I encountered is the badly overclocking I paid for. I ran my games and after 10-15mins, my computer restarts constantly. I had to do a hard reset to remove overclocking to fix the issue…

After making a configuration I’ve decided to upgrade but I was not able to do so. Upon receiving the PC I found a loose tiny piece of metal inside right next to the motherboard. And I loose rubber piece on top of the motherboard. Also a screw not all the way screwed in.

Review.Titre: the i 9 config works great BUT
Review.Contenu: the i 9 config works great. BUT after getting the computer there was no default cooling fans. I gess i didnt check mark the correct box or something even thoe the invoice said default case fans included. customer service was great sent me 2 new fans free of charge. THAT WAS THE FIRST ISSUE . wire management was poor at best. Power cord to the graphics card was ran in front of the card and hitting one of the card fans. Wires to the water cooler were laying on the mother board not ran anywhere. I feel wire management is kind a the signature of the builder and the company. Makes me wonder in the back of my mind what else was done in a rush. Over all for the price good pc. If you dont look at the small stuff.
Computer functions, but came with an underpowered CPU cooler meaning I had to spend an extra 180 dollars to fix it.

Review.Titre: There was Styrofoam left in the bottom…
Review.Contenu: There was Styrofoam left in the bottom bay of my pc and to remove it i had to unplug and un route every wire. WHICH i payed to be professionally done. This is about the only thing i have found annoying and very very upsetting.

Review.Titre: I dislike that the aio cooler isn’t…
Review.Contenu: I dislike that the aio cooler isn’t working as it should. LCD screen not displaying temperature. Aio cooler is cooling but no way to adjust it computer app doesn’t detect it.

Build quality was lackluster this time around. The cable management in my build is not acceptable. There is a big pile of cables tied together directly behind my AIO's radiator that looks horrible and affects air flow into the case. I've seen many builds of this case where there are absolutely no cables showing. Also, I paid for a premium fan upgrade and only 1/3 of them were installed; the other two being sent in a box. I've seen builds where people have easily put 5 fans in this case, but it seems the builders didn't want to have to go through that trouble.

I'll start by saying the end product is excellent and good quality, that is the only reason they're getting 3 stars. The customer service is some of the worst I've ever dealt with, took almost 2 weeks to find out they haven't even started building it yet when it was supposed to be shipped by then. You have to really pester them to find out any information on the order you spend thousands of dollars on, blows my mind.

Review.Titre: Great service and quick to build and…
Review.Contenu: Great service and quick to build and deliver, however, PC arrived and was unable to turn on so had to return.

Once I made the purchase, everything went really quickly and smoothly. However, the representative was unable to answer questions regarding the products or the build. I wasn't given the option to chat with technical staff to learn about the build.So far everything is working great, but the machine seems to run a little hot.Updates:I was disappointed to discover a unused cable attached to the power supply unit zip tied with the other cables.The case accessories were missing, I reached out to them, and they said they'd try to send me a replacement. I received the replacement less than two weeks later, thank you!

Review.Titre: Prices are rated decently and computer…
Review.Contenu: Prices are rated decently and computer was built and shipped in timely manner, but did have minor issue when recieved but didn't seem be fault of their's and was easy fix of removing and reinstalling GPU. Then 4 days later power supply went bad removed for replacement and had damage but no damage to case so only could have been damaged before installation causing failure.

Overall decently happy in the week I've had the computer. Pros- PC arrived in one piece and worked on the first start up.Cons- Professional cable wiring, which was an additional charge, was poorly done. Parts of the case look extremely tangled. Also, during the ordering process, no options were available to add more NVME drives, which on an Hyte with a vertically mounted GPU is necessary unless you want to pull out the GPU and riser cables to access the other half of the MB.

Review.Titre: If I could it would be a 2.5 / 5
Review.Contenu: If I could it would be a 2.5 / 5 mainly for a few reasons, 1 the glass on the front of the computer case exploded, second actually talking to the team putting the computer together was a hassle, 3rd actually having a ETA on parts or even just saying on your website which parts have inventory or not would be better. Lastly for a positives I do love my pc but whoever did the wiring could have done a way better job.

My CyberPower PC was constructed of name branded components.  However, the professional wiring that I paid extra for was very poorly done.  All the wires had to be removed on receipt as the fans wire disconnected and the fan controller was jammed behind a rats nest of  wires.  Also, I requested and paid for overclocking but every components is running at stock.

Review.Titre: New PC crashing, components not compatible
Review.Contenu: The computer started crashing as soon as I started playing games, then while downloading games and opening up google chrome, it gave me a blue screen.  I found out that the Asus motherboard I ordered along with the Ryzen 7800X3D Chip and DDR5-6000MHz RAM are not compatible. Once I updated the BIOS and underclocked my RAM from 6000MHz to 5200MHz everything worked fine, but that's not what I paid for, and they really should have someone review the components before they ship the PC, it doesn't take much research to see that the Asus motherboards are problematic with Ryzen 7000 Series Chips and 6000MHz + RAM.  However the support guy was helpful and responded quickly when I had questions.

The price and part availability was on point. Overall I'm happy with the purchase, though the assembly was sub par at best. They snapped off one of the psu screws in the psu, and misthreaded another. There was various other wire damage, and the plastic release clip for gpu pcie slot was also broken off. Just a sloppy assembly overall. I would expect more care on a $4000 machine.

Review.Titre: I gave 3 stars just cause I've never…
Review.Contenu: I gave 3 stars just cause I've never had any issues with Cyberpower PC. I recently spent almost 3k on a PC so I was expecting it to work at arrival but the GPU wasn't displaying anything at all. Customer service was helpful but couldn't solve the issue. I was so happy when it arrived only to have this issues. Idk if it was shipping or if it wasn't fully checked prior to being sent.

Review.Titre: Good selection of parts and build…
Review.Contenu: Good selection of parts and build within expected prices arrived quick and ontime.  Problems with shipping and damage or QC as the motherboard or video card was defective got an error 97 on boot noticed that the stabilization packing for the rtx 4090 was just not enough to keep the card in place during shipping.  Case ordered has a bracket for support but was not installed during build.

Review.Titre: It doesn't have issues per say but I…
Review.Contenu: It doesn't have issues per say but I have noticed some silly things that it'll do. On certain games the fps heavily fluctuates, but that could just be crappy internet. But other than those issues all seem to be fine.

Review.Titre: Part was unavailable even though it…
Review.Contenu: Part was unavailable even though it allowed me to order it. No one contacted me concerning this and I had to ask where my system was before we could swap the part. Once that process was done everything went smoothly.

Review.Titre: Generally good products, needs a bit of work on customer service.
Review.Contenu: Company products (this is my second computer from them) are generally solid, well built. Customer service is spotty, am still waiting for a mouse I ordered with this laptop (delivered several weeks ago) but otherwise pretty good laptop. Gaming chair I ordered with last computer was missing a few key  parts, and 3 years after the sale they still haven't sent the replacements. So, on the computers themselves, well built. On fixxing problems after they have your money, not so much so.

Review.Titre: Well I loved the computer and packaging…
Review.Contenu: Well I loved the computer and packaging but you guys put my order on hold without notifying me, also I didn't get a mouse at all with my order not even a standard one. I'm 100 percent sure I ordered a non standard mouse. I think the product was great but customer service was subpar.

Prebuilt arrived with large video card dangling 90% out of its slot.  Broken piece of plastic from motherboard found in bottom of case.  Metal bracket on video card bent 20 degrees away from board itself.  Rear mounting panels bent and pulled away from rest of case body. Seems video card was Inadequately secured during shipment. Should probably pack them separately or add support bracket given average size / weight of cards now. 1 of 4 Case fans is dead on arrival. Won’t bother asking them to fix as there are too many horror stories of people not receiving their computer back for 1+ months AND having to pay shipping charges for problems they didn’t create.  Machine works fine though. Overall appearance nice.   Will hesitate to buy from them again given issues above. Not a great first experience with a company.

I ordered a PC with a set delivery date.  Apparently the video card was out of stock or discontinued and another was substituted, not a problem really.  However then the ship by date came and went with no information.  When I queried customer service the responses were pretty much terrible.  The first simply said "Order number?" that was it, nothing eles.  The ticket clearly stated the order number was optional and my order should have been easily found by my name.  The second response after me providing my order number was a reprint of what I could already see online, no new information, apology for missing the ship date, nothing.If not for that it would have been a 5-star review.

Review.Titre: Everything was fine but the Corsair…
Review.Contenu: Everything was fine but the Corsair fans they installed won't even show up on the icue app. I'm contacting them today to see if they have some insight on why this $3k computer wasn't ready to go when it got to me.

Bought a pre-built pc, cyperpower uses garage parts for the most important components. They opted to use a apevia atx pr800w 80 gold crefited and it popped in 4 days and shot volts out the back of my pc, I had assume ot was my doing and not wanting to ruin my build by buying the wrong type of psu I opted to buy the same one for 71$ on Amazon.  It lasted 3 days and I didn't even use it on the second day. Stop using garbage  parts

i would have given this a 4 star since the only thing wrong was a faulty graphics card and when i cald customer support the first time the guy was polite and helpful.  however i dropped it down a star because the second time i called support the guy was rude and kept cutting me off before i could get a full sentence in. I like the company this is the 2nd pc ive bought frome them, the first lasted me 9 years so i would still recommend them.

Review.Titre: The PC arrived and the 4090 I purchased…
Review.Contenu: The PC arrived and the 4090 I purchased refused to work. I attempted to call the tech support line and simply felt I was being rushed out the door to try fixes from their guides. They did not want to talk me through anything, and said to call back if I had issue. Turns out the issue was with how the power was being supplied, and sending the 4090 back like they wanted would not have fixed anything. We're still using the CyberPower cables and everything, just displeased I had to have someone else assist me with troubleshooting. Otherwise the PC is working fine, so 3/5

Value: goodPart quality: goodOrdering experience: below average. You can make many invalid combinations.Communication: Poor. Rather than correct an oversight they will include an item in the box.Build quality: Average. Generally I try to pay to avoid my skill level of work, so slightly annoyed whenever it looks like I could have done better.RGB compatibility: non existent

Seems okay so far. Had to refund a PC because I didn’t do enough research and I learned that there were some parts that were pretty much ticking time bombs. (Anything by APEVIA) customer support seems alright, can be a little bit nicer though. There was one red flag where one of the guys I called said “you shouldn’t listen to the reviews” and other stuff like that. The PC looked very beautiful when it came, I didn’t get to turn it on and see if everything worked though. Hasn’t been much communication about if they’ve received the package or not. The website could definitely be better. Should tell us everything that is compatible together and what is not compatible together. Besides those few little things, they seem great so far.

Review.Titre: Overall was very excited to receive my…
Review.Contenu: Overall was very excited to receive my brand new gaming pc and was ecstatic when I got it. But my gpu ended up being dead the first few days after getting it. I get it parts always a lot of the time end up being faulty but the fact that it takes 7-10 business day to receive a new one is absurd. Especially when the faulty one I shipped was received the next day

Order was about a month later than it was estimated. Was told twice “it will ship next week” before it actually shipped the following week, so it was more than 3 weeks late.I paid for 3 day shipping so I could have it early May, but I tried to get it refunded because of the delay and the guy was pretty rude about it.Overall, the computer is great, but the service sucked and no one seemed to care about getting me real dates that I could work around.Especially bad when considering it’s for a $2,500 PC.

Review.Titre: I purchased a Cyberpower PC with AMD…
Review.Contenu: I purchased a Cyberpower PC with AMD 7800X3D CPU and ASROCK X670E PG Lightning MB.  The 7800X3D has voltage /overheat issues and a critical BIOS update is needed.  When I received the PC my 1st priority was checking the BIOS version it was 1.1  The critical BIOS update was 2.1 and I was unable to update it even with the help of Cyberpower Tech Support.  I immediately returned the PC to Cyberpower for the BIOS to be corrected.  ASROCK should design a way for users and Tech Support to update BIOS, or have a recall on said motherboards.

Review.Titre: I am happy with my new PC… ALTHOUGH the…
Review.Contenu: I am happy with my new PC… ALTHOUGH the only problem is that you guys didn’t give me all of the fans that came within it. I had CyberpowerPC MasterLiquid Lite 360mm ARGB CPU Liquid Cooler with Dual Chamber Pump & Copper Cold Plate (3 x Standard 120MM Fans) and 6X 120mm APEVIA 120mm Addressable RGB 1200RPM Fans… I was only given 6 in total with the side fan but didn’t receive my 3Aprevia fans at the bottom so I had to purchase the fans myself. Other than that the PC runs good and I was able to plug and play.

Review.Titre: I disliked the fact that I didn’t get…
Review.Contenu: I disliked the fact that I didn’t get what I thought I purchased. The website is a little misleading. Power cable was missing. AIO cooler lights stoped working on the second day. Right dust cover missing on keyboard. Desktop also would not wake up from sleep mode without hard reset. Probably the main thing I would mention is that at no point has anyone offered any assistance to resolve the issues.  It like your company literally can’t be bothered really off putting. Don’t know that I’d buy from you again.

I bought a fairly expensive PC, including a 4090 GPU, and I9-13900 CPU.  The process of getting the computer was fast, and they communicated the few changes they had to make on my custom build, due to back ordered parts, and size limitations of the case.  The two negative aspects were that the front panel does not work correctly, and support told me that they could not help me with that.  Also, a few of the cables were not plugged into the motherboard, and were not even in the right vicinity on the motherboard (so I had to undo wires and move them across the motherboard to the right place).  It was obvious Quality Control was not done on some of the PC like the front panel among other items.

Review.Titre: Online configuration great - responding to my order and my question, not great
Review.Contenu: The online order process is top notch - very easy to swap components, compare and feel good that everything is compatible.  However, I did not pay for rush service and apparently enough other people did that my order sat there with no progress until the 'expected ship date'.  Then there was a rush to get it out the door.  While it sat there doing nothing I wrote asking if there was anything on my end that was slowing it down.  I got a canned robot response that did not address my question.  I then received an email asking about how my inquiry was handled.  I told them it seemed like a chatbot and my question wasn't answered.  No response.  I'm sure I'm going to love the machine itself.  But as far as my ordering experience, I'm not too pleased with it.

Amazing PC, Great tech support, slow warranty support. 5 star PC, 5 star tech support 1 star warranty support. The ASRock gaming PC was great out of the box, the video card was bad as soon as I opened the container. The screens would not load. 2-4 week wait for a new GPU (video card) for a brand new PC. This would have been a 5 star review except no test were completed before you shipped it to me to catch the faulty video card.
Recieved damaged product. either forced to pay for extra shipping to send it in to get it fixed, and wait ANOTHER few weeks to get my computer back or just deal with a damaged product.

Review.Titre: My system was not functioning as expected
Review.Contenu: Despite many positive reviews of CyberpowerPC and their products being sold in Bestbuy, I had a bad experience. CyberpowerPC build my customized PC with AMD Ryzen 7900X3D CPU, ASROCK X670E motherboard, 32 GB RAM, NVIDIA GEFORCE 3060TI graphics card, Cyberpower Deepcool 360 Liquid Cooling,..,   and delivered on time. But, from day one, I encountered multiple problems, (1) The system does not go into "sleep mode" (2) The RGB Liquid Cooling fans were very loud, (3) The fans and RGB lights are not detected and can't be controlled thru the motherboard. The tech support was very nice, they tried to resolve it over few days,  but failed. Unfortunately, within 4 days, I requested a return and CyberpowerPC issued a return label. It was very stressful and cost me time. It appeared that it was an assembly problem and a low-quality fan was used.

My order was fine, but I wanted to change 1 part on the pc.Getting ahold of customer service was a bit difficult but talking to them was much worse, they seemed unfriendly and annoyed by my request.The date I actually recieved my computer was more than 2 weeks beyond my estimated date.

Review.Titre: I ordered a PC from cyber power
Review.Contenu: I ordered a PC from cyber power. I ordered the creator ultimate PC with an i9 and RTX 4090. The PC came in with no damage to the case. However upon further inspection i noticed multiple pins on the motherboard bent out of shape. I also noticed when turning the PC on that 2 fans do not light up however they do work as intended but the lighting doesn’t work on them. Everything else is good. The computer works. But for $4,000 I’m relatively angry about pins being bent and my cpu cooler not lighting up at all along with my case fans also not lighting up. I won’t be doing any RMA on the PC since cyberpower is notoriously terrible with customer support so I’ll be fixing this with my own money after I’ve already spent 4 grand.

Shipping and handling: still an't got m package even tho I paid full price on my package. When I was asking what happened because it was to arrive the 7/21 they said ups was hacked and they had to ship it back it was less then 4 hours away.. so here I am waiting for it to ship back the cyberpc witch arrives 7/28 from ups tracking. And when I was more details on the package as in was it shipped to the worng address or did it stay in receiving at up. Or if the strike had anything to do with it I get threatened they will refunded my package for asking questions. So have a wonderful day i'll wait on my package because i'm anxious and worried & concerned after spending over 3,000 on itHave a wonderful day an for Shipping if they did get hacked it's on ups not you guys just anxious is all and sorry if I mad anyone mad or discouraged. But I feel disheartened waiting just to see it so close an wait almost a week just to watch it go back to cyberpowerpc.

Review.Titre: I ordered this system with added hard…
Review.Contenu: I ordered this system with added hard disks, with specific for one to be configured in Raid format for backup. This was not done.I am having problems trying to configure it myself.I wrote to person who was handling my order and have zero response.

Review.Titre: 3 Stars might be a little high…
Review.Contenu: 3 Stars might be a little high considering my pc was delivered with a bad motherboard. The return process wasn't too much of a hassle it came back 2 weeks later and everything has been running great since. If it hadn't been delivered with a bad part I could have awarded 5 stars.

Review.Titre: I had a difficult time placing my order
Review.Contenu: I had a difficult time placing my order.  My billing address on my credit card and my desired shipping address were in two different states.  I understand the need for security, but I felt that I was made to jump through hoops.  I had to photograph and upload my driver's license and credit card.  Somehow that was not enough.  I finally contacted my credit card issuer and resolved the problem in seconds.  The irony is that I had the exact same problem about nine years ago, and it was resolved quickly and easily.  I still have the documentation to prove it. After some additional trouble in uploading my order to the shopping cart, everything was fine.  I should not have to spend four days to order a computer.  I intend to purchase another computer in the next few months.  What guarantee do I have that my ordering experience will be any better?

The computer seems great, but I'm not happy the cooling unit is on backorder. I was originally told it would be sent 2-3 business days behind the computer, had to email THREE TIMES to get an update, and I still don't have the unit almost two weeks later. When will it arrive? I have no idea...

3rd Build and final purchasePros: Customizable PC with lots of good options.Website user friendly.Cons: Delivery too long. I was allowed to build the PC even though the parts were not in stock.PC Memory speed in bios was set incorrectly.PC Windows failed on first day.  Had to restore.

Overall the build seems ok.  What I purchased is in the machine.  The case is torqued a little and does wobble a bit.  The cooling fans and CPU radiator are not setup properly.  They actually blow against each other inside the case.  I'll have to take it apart to fix this on my own.  For a $4k custom order, you'd expect this not to happen.

Review.Titre: The computer works but extra instructions ignored entirely
Review.Contenu: The computer works but extra instructions ignored entirelyThe fan orientation was not as I had requested.  I even emailed the sales rep my preference on how the fans should be oriented and got a reply back that my message will be relayed to the builders.  Well, there was a breakdown in communication as nothing was done that I asked.  I had to talk with CPPC with regards to sending me screws to fix the radiator orientation, call Phanteks to get covers for the fans I got with the PC and will have to remove the radiator along with all the fans currently installed to put them where I informed them where I wanted them.  This will take me maybe an hour and a half which kind of defeats the purpose of me buying a prebuilt that could have extra instructions.This is the fifth CPPC computer I have and the first one I would not rate a 5 out of 5.

Review.Titre: Good computer, sloppy wiring job, had to troubleshoot one of the fans soon as I powered it on.
Review.Contenu: The order was fulfilled promptly and correctly. The main issue I have/had is that the wiring job was very sloppy, and when I say sloppy I mean way too much wiring just crammed behind the mother board and around/underneath the fans. The only reason I noticed is because I had to troubleshoot one of the radiator fans on the liquid cooling system. 1 out of 4 fans would not turn on. BIOS settings looked correct so I had to check the wiring. Sure enough, there was a bad connection where a section of wire near the base of one of the connectors was essentially folded over itself I think it wasn't making contact with one or more of the connector pins. For now, I just unbent it and that seemed to work as long as we don't move the computer a whole bunch or nothing like that. Hence why I might need to just redo the wiring. For an almost $3k computer I thought I would be paying for quality manufacturing but it was obviously very rushed and sloppy. I'm happy with my purchase, it works, but I hope I don't run into any more issues due to the wiring issues.

Review.Titre: Shattered Glass, Bent Case, components effected
Review.Contenu: PC functions but on arrival the glass side panel was shattered, and the metal framed on the back right was bent inward. This, in turn, cause the graphics card to be forcefully removed from the motherboard port. I had to loosen the screws on the back panel in order to get it to fit!

Review.Titre: Product itself is fine as usual
Review.Contenu: Product itself is fine as usual. However it took 4 weeks to receive. Estimated shipping date meant anything. They didn’t back order the missing parts till 3 weeks passed.

I bought 2 of the same pc basically, just one  have more upgraded parts, one computer gave me everything that came with the motherboard like its accessories and the case accessories box. The other computer had nothing extra like y’all kept all the extra accessories i would probably need in the future that belong to the motherboard and case.

Review.Titre: Bunch of scratches all over my case
Review.Contenu: Bunch of scratches all over my case, was expecting a lot better from a company I used to trust…

Review.Titre: Computer ran good but the cable work…
Review.Contenu: Computer ran good but the cable work was to tight could of caused damage case came damaged but they refused to send me a new case without sending the whole pc back.

Review.Titre: Computer is good, customer service is terrible
Review.Contenu: Like the computer, some of the accessories are very overpriced. Overall it’s great for what I need however, the customer support is f’ing terrible. I spent 5500 and they act like “whatever”. 2 people I called to help w the purchase were rude or apathetic. One person was willing to actually help. Once complete, there was a part missing and they wouldn’t overnight it, I had to wait additional time. I paid for Ms office and that’s still in a trial/monthly basis, have to call and fix that. Just no f’s given. If the computer was perfect, the customer service ruined it. I wouldn’t recommend them based off that. Don’t get so apathetic to people spending large amounts of money on computers, you’ll kill your customer base quickly.Edit- the manufacturer response is generic and at this pint too late. Why would I be reaching out to customer support that were apathetic before to reach out now for any current issues. Resolve this through proper training, please.

Review.Titre: Solid products, terrible communication and timeliness
Review.Contenu: The product itself is fine, once you finally get it. What they don’t tell you is that if you select a part and it is back ordered when they go to build it, they won’t tell you or update your order status. The day they were scheduled to ship will come and go with no updates. If you call for an update, they will have you call back when certain people are in the office. While you are waiting for one part that is back ordered, they may use the last of another part, so now you are waiting on a different part. Some employees will work with you to select an alternate part, while others insist that you have to submit a change request form. My $4000 PC was close to a month late on delivery.

Review.Titre: I ordered a gaming laptop from this company…
Review.Contenu: I ordered a laptop from this company which they did get built and sent to my house on time. The customer support were very polite and professional. It was very well packaged. When I took it out and powered it up it ran smoothly. It has some sort of faulty party or loose wire because it will randomly crash for no apparent reason. It does it often. I will be sending it back this Monday to be repaired. It is just very annoying to buy a 2k plus gaming laptop and it arrive new with an obvious defect.

I ordered a case with three fans in the front with a mesh front and side. I also ordered a 360 radiator  and assumed they would mount it in the top since it would fit. Nope they mounted it in the front so instead of fresh air entering the case the are putting the heat from the cpu back into the case and the gpu. I called your support team and they said that it would work like that and if it did overheat then return it. Why I asked would you not fix it so it would not be a problem. They also stated the the air is being discharged out of the case. It is clear the fans will be blowing into the case. Finally after some Snickers from them I hung up. The whole experience is disgusting.

purchasing process awesome. carlo is amazing. wiring in case was poor. computer was not prof wired nor was it boxed in the option i picked for safer transport. paid for both for nothing. other than that great.

CyberPowerPC has some of the cheapest custom PC prices on the market, especially if you make sure to take advantage of their specials. Their configurator is also one of the most comprehensive ones out there. It would be difficult to get more bang for your buck without building your own rig. At the end of the day my new PC kicks ass, but it took some work to get there.  Unfortunately they seem to cut corners with customer service (Both times I contacted them the representatives were very curt and eager to end the interaction), don't update their storefront to reflect out of stock parts, and nickel and dime you for industry standard things. Like charging for foam protection for the inside of your PC during shipping, and not double-boxing for shipping. My shipment arrived so beat up its a miracle the PC wasn't damaged (although that's on UPS). It also clearly displayed what was inside the box, which makes it a tempting target for theft. I also paid for their professional wiring service (why aren't all PCs "professionally wired"?) and the cable management is about as messy as it could be... In fact I had to plug in a hard drive that was left fully disengaged.

Review.Titre: Good product, customer service needs some work…
Review.Contenu: Received products without them being inside a box. So my computer is exposed and everyone can see what it is. They did not ship one of my 5 items. And customer service was nice but could not figure out that they didnt ship the item.

Review.Titre: The customer support was great Nathan…
Review.Contenu: The customer support was great Nathan did a great job however the pc arrived with motherboard damage and the dimm slot for the ram was also damaged.

Overall al right experience. I paid for pro wiring, when I opened the back up it was a rats nest. Not the end of the world but shouldn’t have paid $20 for that and the 3 zip ties used, the excess was snipped off and left in the case. There was thermal paste on the front of my gpu heat sink from cpu cooler install. The price was good, cpu cooler had a small crack on the pump housing so I had to rma that. In the end I’m not disappointed, I ended up saving money with their sales minus the few small details.
Definitely would have improved the rating if it didn't take weeks of emails back and forth and then nothing actually happening.  Finally, a phone call was able to remedy the problem.

Review.Titre: Powerful PC at a competitive price.
Review.Contenu: The PC is as advertised, however make sure you get them to send the complete paperwork and additional parts. I did not get the motherboard book as well as other documents. I needed to install another M.2 drive and there was no set screws in the M.2 slots.Also they charge extra for packing it properly. That is seriously wrong! You will have to remove the video card to get the expansion foam out. At least with the case I purchased. Since they also charge extra for doing the wiring correctly, which is also seriously wrong! The wiring can get so tight that it will pull apart in places you don't expect it to. So beware to check every connection before boot up. Especially the adapter connector to the video card. The 4080 I opted for used this and I found the adapter cable had come loose upstream, this caused the video card to not function properly. After reseating all the cables it worked fine. So just be aware. Otherwise the PC is working great and the turn around and build time was as stated.
I like this computer except for the fact that it keeps locking up and freezing of system.  Also gaming u stopped working.   And could not find anywhere to replace faulty software.

The graphics card is broken, everything else is working perfectly but the graphics card is crashing the whole pc. I replaced the graphics card with one from my old pc and it works fine. Still waiting for any response from the support team.

The system works great. The only issue I have with this build is the LED controller seems to have went out shortly after starting it for the first time. All the fans still work without issue, but no lights anymore. I work quite a bit and have been unable to get them working again with my limited time to troubleshoot. Outside of that issue, the system is great.

Decent prices, good selection of components: I almost got what I really wanted. If you shop for computers based on components you'll know what I mean. Obviously they can't stock everything.The PC was packaged well and arrived undamaged UPS 3-day select shipping (which took 6 days to arrive) and 100% functional. The Amethyst II case only has room for a single HDD, which I was disappointed to discover after the fact. Otherwise the case is acceptable (I can't stand all the lame LED lighting on current computers - waste of power and if they had offered a plain, solid case without any of that I'd have selected it. I don't like pretending we live in the world of TRON II. But they didn't at the time of this order (May, 2023)).I received contradicting information from the salesman versus the auto-updates on their website. Everything arrived on time and as ordered though. I think I would order again, since having them put it all together saved me a lot of time, frustration, and possible minor compatibility issues. Right now, June 8, 2023, everything is working flawlessly.Product = *****Interaction with sales = **Overall experience = ***Having said that, I would probably buy from them again and would recommend them if you would rather pay someone to assemble your new custom PC than do it yourself. But you may not find precisely what you seek.

I currently own a CP computer purchased from Best Buy several years ago. It has been a great computer so when I need to upgrade, CP was my first choice. I ordered the new computer online without any problems. A few days later, I received an email that my order was on hold as the video card I ordered was out of stock. I phoned customer support and was told he could install another video card which I accepted so the order could be completed. Upon checking the CP website, I noticed that you were including a 4 TB disk drive and a keyboard and mouse free with any custom order. I recontacted customer service and requested these items be included in my order. I was told they would not change my order to include them but I could cancel my order and reorder to get them. My computer had not been built at this point but I was facing a deadline to receive it before leaving in a planned vacation. The customer service tech knew about my deadline and that if I reordered, I would not receive it in time. If he could change my order for the video card, he could have added these free items. I am very unhappy about this and feel that he took advantage of my situation to save a few bucks. My computer did arrive on time and looks great.

Review.Titre: Great beast, but two main issues
Review.Contenu: The machine is an absolute beast.  Runs all my games at top frame rates.  My only complaint is that i have a Cyber Cube Case and for the last 6 months there is a very loud squeal coming from inside.  I tried to find it and just couldnt.  The sound starts out as a low screech then escalates to a high pitch wine.  Comes and goes.  The other thing is my machine is liquid cooled and the cpu block should light up and does not.

Review.Titre: A lot of money to have a broken piece…
Review.Contenu: A lot of money to have a broken piece of plastic stuck inside the case up against the glass where it can't be reached without taking out the fans.
The computer is great. The customer service is pretty lacking. There isn't many places that I've had worse service "customer" wise. Definitely lacking.

Review.Titre: They completely forgot a cover on the…
Review.Contenu: They completely forgot a cover on the back of my case and then sent the wrong part to correct it.the gap is big enough I can shove my fingers into the area and I mean all four fingers
Cable management was miserable and definitely nothing a PC builder should be proud of. PC it self functions well and the package was as expected.

The Samsung 990 had a recall so they asked me to choose a different ssd, all other options were cheaper and the one I chose was $60 less. They never offered or implemented a refund for the difference. They failed to do the professional wiring I paid for too. I brought this to their attention 2 weeks ago, I’ve still not received the $100+ back they owe me. Computer freezes for about 20-30 seconds multiple times a day, since day one. Called them about this issue today and the manager I was connected to acts like he can’t hear me on the phone. Refund the money you owe me and give me the tech support so I have a normal running machine, a new 13900k and 4090 PC shouldn’t be having these issues and ya’lls quality control is lacking.  I'm sending the PC back for them to repair and still waiting for the refund, will update this review in the future depending on the results.Update: The money owed to me was sent back to my CC.  I'm glad they sent the money back but I should have never had to pursue them for it.  Had I never called them to ask where the difference was between the ssd i ordered and paid for and the cheaper one I ended up having to get I am quite sure they would have pocketed it and kept it moving.

I love the computer. The parts were exactly what I ordered. Right out of the box the lighting on the fans is shorting out and the rgb isn't working properly. Could have done a bit better, but the computer does work fine.

Review.Titre: The disappointing piece is offering a…
Review.Contenu: The disappointing piece is offering a product and not having it. I really looked forward to those monitors. I wasn’t even offered an alternative.
Everything is great. The only bad thing is that all of the feet were broken on arrival. It could have been a shipping issue but it is an issue nonetheless.

Review.Titre: I paid extra to have my pc built in 3…
Review.Contenu: I paid extra to have my pc built in 3 days the for 2 day shipping. Once my pc came in it did not have a power cable. I then had to proceed over a week to wait for the power cable. Even though I paid for 2 day shipping and it was 2 days they said they could only do 3 which ended up being way over 3. The pc itself turned out great but I am very disappointed in how it was handled.

Review.Titre: The physical build quality is great, but...
Review.Contenu: The physical build quality is great and the PC was packaged perfectly for shipping. My only complaint is that it seems the hardware was not configured to take advantage of the components purchased. The motherboard is low quality (I blame ASRock for this and not Cyberpower) so trying to run the memory which is rated at 6000mghz at the rated speed is not possible. The system is incredibly unstable. So the memory was set to be downclocked to 4800MGhz because enabling XMP causes the system to be unstable. As I said this is a problem with ASRock but I think Cyberpower should NOT be selling boards that are not compatible with the other components because it is very misleading to the customer to purchase one thing and have those parts hadnicaped because Cyberpower didn't tell us that the motherboard they say was "OC Certified" isn't actually certified it seems.

Review.Titre: Everything was good except my led…
Review.Contenu: Everything was good except my led controller the middle buttons don’t work at all. Lowkey got me disappointed.

Review.Titre: Everything was great but the delivery…
Review.Contenu: Everything was great but the delivery arrived damaged. I sent word to cyberpower several days ago and still have no response.

Review.Titre: I immediately had some issues off the…
Review.Contenu: I immediately had some issues off the bat first nothing would come up on my monitor then it wouldn't boot I had to reinstall windows on it but everything seems to be working fine now

Review.Titre: Several items weren't delivered that I…
Review.Contenu: Several items weren't delivered that I had ordered in the package, namely a mouse pad and the Diablo 4 Ultimate edition.  Other than that, the computer was in fantastic condition, looks and runs great and I have experienced nothing but excellent performance with what was delivered.

Review.Titre: I bought a custom PC from cyberpower…
Review.Contenu: I bought a custom PC from cyberpower instead of building my own.  He was the positives and negatives of my experience.Positives:Custom site builder is the best compared to others.Pricing is the best as well (basically same price as me building)Options for custom building are terrificPackaging for delivery was well done, computer shipped in cases box then stuffed to avoid any potential movement issues. Negatives:Est ship date was never possible since they sold me PC that they didn't have parts forCustomer service people are awful/don't respond half the time/clearly don't care when you callOrdered a set of 3 fans to be installed, they installed two, sent me one, then installed a random third that was different brand and color.  The third I ordered could have been installed elsewhere in PC and they sell matching fans that would have fit where they put the random one"Professional wiring" was a joke, if this was the "extra" level I'd hate to see what regular level was that didn't cost extra. I don't think they did quality control like they said they did because upon starting PC two of the stock fans that were plugged into daisy connection were running weird (making noise when they ran).  I took these two out and ran the extra fan I ordered directly to MOBO and it resolved the issue.So, TLDR, shipping date they sell you on is misleading, customer service isn't great, pro wiring and air flow is a joke (this is something extra you pay for), but PC pricing and options is good. It seems to be running fine now that I did driver updates and fan control.

The Bad First: Wiring for one of the case fans was wedged between the motherboard back plate and the chassis, sandwiching the wire across the onboard display port.  The only way to fix this is to remove the motherboard and all components that are attached to it, re-route the wire and reseat the motherboard. This is unacceptable and shows poor quality control procedures within the company.  How did this pass quality control? The top of the case was also not screwed down and secured nor did they supply me with a single spare case screw so I could not even screw it down myself.  Not a single case part or screw was supplied with the system, no motherboard manuals, no spare parts.  Nothing.  Very disappointed in the quality control from CyberPower PC on this particular build.  Okay the good:  The system was operational and I had no problems with it turning on or not working properly.   The system is clean and the wiring is neat.  They did supply me with my extra case fans "That I purchased extra as a kit of 5" that would not fit.  It only needed 2 of the 5 so I have 3 of them as spares.  I called in to the tech support team and they were very helpful and kind and said they would send me case screws so I can secure the top of the case.  As far as the motherboard squishing a wire in the backplate? Well for that I would have to pack it up and send it back.  I'm just going to leave the wire as is as I don't plan to use the onboard display port.  The other workings of the system seemed to be installed correctly such as: The coolant CPU temps, FAN Control and LED.  I didn't have to rewire and connect things up to the motherboard that were forgotten or anything like that.  I would have loved to have given CyberPowerPC a 5 star review as I've purchased 4 rigs from them throughout the years but not securing the case and the wire issue suggests that they skipped QC at least on this build.  I just can't give more than 3 for that.

Start to finish Gr8.....EXCEPT:1. I Paid for Custom Wiring with Custom wire harness that was supposed to be completely white.It was shipped half white and half black and bald up in front of the video card exhaust .(This is what is displayed  right in the front view of the PC.) I'm not sure who thinks that this is acceptable on a $6200.oo build . Not in my universe.I am sure that if I were to take a picture of this RAT nest ball. And put it on line with a copy of the receipt.This would cost you business.And that should embarrass those who worked so hard and diligently to get this build done .2. Video card Not level . 3. Found rubber gromet Black about 1/4 inch square.Lodged under front glass panel .Still doing a lot of testing of this PCs ability to run in this chassis and cool properly. hope this was honest enough for you.Michael Patton

Review.Titre: PC was missing control center necessary…
Review.Contenu: PC was missing control center necessary to run the water cooler. Water cooler leaked water everywhere due to a loose fitting.

Review.Titre: The ordering was easy, but it broke twice
Review.Contenu: The ordering was easy.  the choices were great.  lots of options. Unfortunately, it came with bad graphics and had to be sent back.  when i got it again, it ran really well and i got everything set up...and then the secondary hard drive failed.  i had to send it back to get the new one.  i'm disabled, so that was an adventure.....took me quite awhile.  i'm just sending it in now.  tech support hasn't give me any hassles so far, but i just wanted a working pc.  i can forgive one issue...it happens.  but two?  /sigh.   lots of my nerd friends and coworkers swear by this website.  and it SEEMS solid.  Frustrating that it failed twice right after receiving it.  it only worked as it should for two weeks or so.  we'll see how it behaves when i receive my new drive and install it.
I like my computer and customer service is very helpful, but two major parts have broken in the year I've owned it.

Review.Titre: Good PC with ALOT of hassle!
Review.Contenu: OK, let me start by saying that the computer I ordered was well-built. However, the issues I experienced were with the graphics card. Once I received my new PC from cyber power PC. I unpackaged everything made all connections plugged monitor into display port on graphics card. And turned on system for first time. The screen was black. Number code indicator on motherboard was a 97. Looking that up it indicated that graphics card was not communicating with motherboard. Attempted to reseat the GPU into motherboard thinking this was the issue still no display. Luckily I had an older PC and was able to remove graphics, card and test in other PC , still same issue with black screen. Plugged in old graphics card from other PC into new PC and that one worked just fine. Called their RMA, which was fast to get a hold of and was able to get the RMA process started. Returned that graphics card as soon as UPS shipping label was printed.  Took about three weeks for the RMA process. Received New graphics card and installed it and everything is now working as it should. Now after almost a month and a half from placing my order until receiving RMA graphics card I now have a working PC. Doing research, I found that this was not a one off issue that this actually happens quite often with cyber power PC.  Some of the explanation that was given is that something must’ve broken on the GPU during shipping. Even though I paid for the extra packaging and care for shipping my item, I still received it in this sort of condition. Also, another thing of note is that the graphics card maker provides a mounting bracket to support GPU and also the case, which is the NV7 also provides a mounting bracket for the GPU to be supported, and neither one of the mounts were used.  I also had suggested to CyberPowerPC PC that when they ship a new PC that the graphics cards should probably ship separately packaged instead of already connected and would probably save them a lot of headache. they could just include a pamphlet on how to install a GPU to the motherboard, which isn’t that hard. Also, another thing that was a bit of a disappointment is that I had also paid for professional wiring. However, the wiring was nice looking in front of the case, but was a nightmare behind the case where all the cables are hidden. And the RGB fans were connected to different controllers, which I had to go in and rewire in order for all RGB to work correctly. Luckily for me I have built several pieces in the past and have an idea of what I am doing. However, for someone who has never built a PC or has a clue I feel this would be troubling for them to have to deal with. I think that most people ordering a PC from a online PC builder want a finished product that they don’t have to mess with out of the box. This is one of the reasons why instead of building my own PC this go around I ordered from cyber power PC was to eliminate having to deal with the hassle. That is not what happened. Next time I will just build my own PC.
PC arrived damaged. I want a replacement for the dinged video card. I will send the video card back upon replacement.

Review.Titre: Be prepared to have some PC knowledge
Review.Contenu: The order process was smooth. The customer service reps I dealt with up to the point of shipping were very droll. It got to me later than expected but that’s ok. The real issues came when I got the tower. All looked and was packaged well. Upon first start up I noticed the front fans were not powering on. I shut the PC down and removed the side panel to take a look. To my discovery, the wiring was a huge mess. There was basically a rats nest of wires and bundles just stuffed into the bottom portion. The connectors for the fan were out of place and had a piece of electrical tape over them(I assume to try and keep them in place). The way this was setup was pretty awful and there is a bundle of board wires that run right over top of the front fan connectors that when the side panel is placed on it applies pressure and easily knocks the connectors loose. These connectors had no grip in place whatsoever and when connected you could disconnect them by simply blowing air from your mouth. I do not know why they were so loose however, after making a few adjustments of my own all is well. I currently do not have the patience to address the rats nest of wiring stuffed in the bottom half right now but I’ll get there eventually. Overall the PC performs as expected of the parts ordered and that’s the only reason I give this a 3 out of 5. The quality of parts seems good but the wiring in general was very poorly done and looked rushed.

Grandson likes the mouse pad. I didn’t like the shipping price. Could have shipped in a flat package for less than in a big box which was too big and shipping cost was as much as the mouse pad itself.

Review.Titre: You guys included a gift card for 50$…
Review.Contenu: You guys included a gift card for 50$ and it was empty when I tried to use it. The computer was really expensive but  it’s a good build
Mobo was faulty on arrival, but customer service was great. Good build, but questionable QA.

CyberPowerPC - Gamer Master - AMD Ryzen 7 5700 - 16GB RAM - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 Ti 8GB - 2TB SSDI bought my first pc through Best Buy during their Black Friday sale. It runs Unity and Unreal Engine 5 really well and the compile times are super quick. It was super easy to set up out of the box and the free keyboard and mouse work well.

The pc is great, no visible damage in shipping running well and no input on my end needed (no internal cables unplugged, pc worked on initial startup. Packaging was good. My only gripe is,  and it's small, but the offer to download Alan Wake 2 expired within 2 days of delivery. Pc arrived on the 11th and the download window was only until the 13th. I was unaware of this and put off setting up my new pc until the weekend. Kind of a shame that an offered bonus was kind of swept from under me due to shipping timing.

Review.Titre: My Custom Ordered PC Arrived in Good Condition
Review.Contenu: I ordered a PC that I was able to customize like I wanted. The PSU I requested was backordered. The sales representative worked with me to get a replacement that was satisfactory though. This did extend the arrival date and my PC arrived after one of the codes for Alan Wake 2 had expired though. Overall the experience was good and their prices were competitive with what I would have paid if I had built the PC myself (The configurator had several items that had aggressive sales to add value and they arrived in good condition)

Awesome CompanyThis is the second time I buy a computer from CyberPowerPC. Love the custom built computer, works great, and cable management is on point.Only issue I had is that it was a little difficult to remove the protective foam when I first got the PC but aside from that, awesome job CyberPowerPC! :D

Review.Titre: It's a great PC but it can't support…
Review.Contenu: It's a great PC but it can't support two monitors

Review.Titre: The online assembly of my new PC was…
Review.Contenu: The online assembly of my new PC was easy and helpful. The pricing was on par with most to all custom build sites.  One complaint is the thought process of the assembly of my new PC, when it comes to airflow. I purposefully purchasesd the Corsair 7000D, which has a side intake/exhaust exchange port. They chose to ignore it and put the included air intakes in front of my MSI 4090 Liquid radiator, that already has 2 fans pulling from behind it, instead creating a more adequate air intake exchange from the side of my case. A little more time spent on making a case have ideal air flow would be nice when someone spends $4K on a PC would be nice.

I would have given 5 stars if there was better communication about shipping. Order status never changed from processing.  If you are requiring a signature upon delivery you should put that somewhere so the customer knows and send the customer the tracking number so we know when the package is to be delivered. Knowing a signature is required may determine where the package is shipped.

CyberPowerPC has a good product, but mine was shipped poorly.  The box was falling apart and I am just hopeful that none of the parts took any damage.  Fortunately the inside of the PC was packed well.  I was not happy with the outside packaging.  Otherwise, so far, so good.
The purchasing experience was great. However, I have been having some difficulties getting my games to start.

Review.Titre: Great overall, messy wiring in back.
Review.Contenu: Ordering was easy.  Had to reach out for updates because a part was back ordered and the status on the order status page wasn’t changing, but when calling they were very personable and provided clear updates.  Only complaint was that the wiring behind the mobo between the back paneling was just jammed in and was a total mess, one of the fans wouldn’t light up because the wires were pinched and bent - I had to completely reroute and clean up the wiring.  From the front the wiring was clean, just in the back.  Everything else worked great and was very easy.

Review.Titre: It was exceptional except for the…
Review.Contenu: It was exceptional except for the wiringPaid for professional wiring to be done and it was all just shoved into the slot next to the power supply. Honestly the rest of the computer looks great but I paid for the wiring on purpose.

Besides all the good parts , I did run into a slight disappointment. As my boyfriends was helping me change out the fans, he noticed bent metal on the CPU cooler ducts.. I was defiantly disappointed, we all know getting a PC arent cheap. I guess its good thing is you cant see the damage.. but I cant help feel a little let down receiving a damaged product. I will contacting them to see what we can do to settle this issue.

Review.Titre: Great Service - Don't pay for all the bells and whistles
Review.Contenu: Easy ordering process, great prices. The only thing that sucked is even after ordering the extra safe packaging, the case still came with three dings/scratches. I did not contact Cyberpower about them as I decided it wasn't worth the hassle. It was the fault of the shipping company. The only other reason I'm not giving five stars is that I thought the cables would be routed nicer by paying for the upgraded cable management/routing. It was tidy but not photo-worthy. I ended up redoing them myself.

Good computer, packaged nicely, consistent updates and on time. This is the 2nd one we bought for my son who is entering into his Freshmen year of college and is studying comp science. He loves the system and overall performance. Only knock was no discount for student or loyal buyers. Would have been a nice incentive to support the purchase.

Everything delivered as promised. Only con was information material. Instruction material on motherboard and computer case would help getting things set up. I have a secondary drive that seems to have died on day 2. (I/O error). I will contact you all about it after I check it out.

In general cyberpowerpc was helpful and got the PC out to me very quickly.  The PC was built very well, except for one minor issue which is the AIO cooler fan wiring which should have gone to the ASUS motherboard instead were plugged into the corsair RGB hub and ran very loudly at 100% all the time.  Also, the BIOS complained about there being no CPU fan plugged it.  It was an easy enough switch. Would give 4.5 stars but it's not an option.

Review.Titre: part availability not shown when ordering
Review.Contenu: Only downside is the site not marking what parts they have in stock. On the plus side, sales team got in contact the next morning. Downside, no response when I asked about part alternatives. Did drop the rush build charge since I had to wait a full month before order was complete.  Build quality was great, but the additional charges to have professional wiring and additional shipping protection is BS when I spend almost $5k. While pleased with the purchase, I will probably go back to doing the build myself when I want to upgrade.

I am satisfied with overall experience ordering the PC.  Everything works fine so far, and have no complaining.  The only reason I gave 4 stars is that they did not have the GPU I ordered, but they did not inform me this, and I was waiting more than 3 weeks.  I contacted them, and they informed me that they are waiting for the part.  I wished they informed me right away when the part was not available so I did not have to wait almost a month to get my pc.

Review.Titre: My custom PC came within 2 weeks and…
Review.Contenu: My custom PC came within 2 weeks and the build itself couldn't have been done any better. The only reason I did not give a 5 star review is because the GPU was Dead On Arrival and I have to go through the RMA process, so it'll be another 2 weeks before I can use my PC to its full potential. I do not blame CyberPower for the GPU being dead, but having the most important part not work when the PC arrives is definitely an issue. Other than that, I received exactly what I wanted.

Deliverd on time, been working great since setup. This configuration is a beast!  I gave it only 4 stars instead of 5 because they could do a better job of identifying all the input and output ports on this computer.  The embossed lettering is so difficult to read. I would suggest better identification in the quick start guide.

My only dissatisfaction is I ordered a LiAn Li Strimer for my gpu and the Strimer came in a box not attached to the pc and a case fan also just put in the box without being attached. I called and asked why and they said “those parts didn’t work in the build” so instead of saying something, they just threw them in the box.Other than that, the pc runs fantastic and I’m overall very satisfied with the build of the pc. The shipping was fast, I paid for extra padding and extended warranty because why not for $40? Very happy with this purchase.

Review.Titre: Amazing PC, best bang for buck
Review.Contenu: I nabbed my first ever pre-built PC and I'm honestly not disappointed. It came well put together, works right out of the box no muss no fuss. Only one issue, my case was either damaged in shipping or assembly because it has a pretty big gouge on one side down to the bare metal. Other than that it's been nothing but a good experience so far. Definitely recommend if you're shopping for a pre-built!

Prompt attention to order and support request. However, I'm slightly miffed by the lack of drive bays. Why have 8 SATA connections if there are only 2 drive bays? Also, UPS delivery service is atrocious! Both the original box and the replacement feet box arrived damaged! Please use any other shipper!!

Overall satisfied with my purchase.  No issues encountered other than some light scratches on the side of the case that did not seem to have happened in shipping as the outer box was free of damage.Would have been five stars if not for the damage that should have been caught before shipping.

Review.Titre: This is my third Cyberpower PC ...
Review.Contenu: This is my third Cyberpower PC so you must be doing something right! CPC generally has a good selection of hardware and is much more reasonably priced than other boutique PC builders. The end-product is fairly well put together too. The website is a bit too busy, and it's unfortunate that they don't offer any computers that aren't blinged out to the max (would it really kill you to offer a PC without a window?) but otherwise a generally good experience overall.

Review.Titre: High Quality Build with Attention to Detail
Review.Contenu: The machine they built was clean as anything I would have built, probably better if I'm honest, and I've been building PCs for twenty years. Honestly impressed with the work presented and the prices are very competitive.

Absolutely zero complaints about my PC once it arrived. No hiccups whatsoever and I could simply plug it in and start gaming.The customer service on the other hand nearly made me reconsider. I made a simple user error and provided the wrong billing address at first. Easy fix right? Wrong. After 20+ emails back and forth, calling my bank to change my billing address, calling customer service, cancelling my order, and starting a new one, I finally got my PC. What really made this a painful process was the customer service representative on the phone was not helpful at all. He tried to gaslight me into saying it was my fault and I was doing it wrong rather than being kind and helping me figure it out. This isn’t an xbox 360 COD lobby, acting like a 16 year old is not acceptable. I sincerely hope whoever I spoke with gets fired. Thanks for the PC tho!

Review.Titre: Great quality at a great price... Unfortunately ships through UPS
Review.Contenu: Title says it all. It's a good pc for a good price, at least for those who do not build their own pcs. The biggest issue is that they ship through UPS, who are an absolute pain to deal with and are prone to make errors requiring time and effort on your part to resolve, as well as delaying your shipment. UPS is the sole reason why this was a 4-star experience instead of a 5-star one.Also, Cyberpower uses slightly suboptimal packaging, with multiple dents on my computer case on arrival. This has not really been an issue for me personally, but is of note.

Review.Titre: Great PC building poor SOP on backordered products.
Review.Contenu: Overall, the company did a great job at building the computer and providing what they offer. The only real complaint is how they handle items that they offer for sell but don't have on hand. If they had contacted me before shipping out the rest of the order about the monitor being on back order I could have worked with them to get things sorted much sooner. Instead I was notified that the product was on back order after the fact and would be shipped out a week later.
